Title: Performance Analyst
Description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we‚Äôre building the delivery of (almost) everything and you‚Äôll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn‚Äôt always easy, but it‚Äôs definitely exciting. Here you‚Äôll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You‚Äôll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you‚Äôre a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

Join our dynamic Operations Analytics Team! As a cornerstone of our organization, this team serves as a one-stop shop for all data analytics needs related to operations and venues. We pride ourselves on our ability to analyze, automate, and guide other teams, functioning as a consultancy/support mechanism. Our work involves close interactions with upper management, contributing significantly to critical strategic discussions. To excel in this role, you must possess a blend of analytical prowess and exceptional communication skills.

What You'll Be Doing


Conducting in-depth analyses using Looker and Excel to support various operational and venue-related teams.
Automating processes to enhance efficiency across departments.
Providing consultancy and support to operational and venue teams to steer their activities based on data-driven insights.
Engaging in regular exchanges with your manager and contributing to strategic decision-making processes.
Preparing reports, occasionally presenting findings through PowerPoint presentations.


Our humble expectations

Must-Haves:


Proficiency in Microsoft Excel
Fluent English skills, both written and verbalStrong analytical skills coupled with the ability to communicate findings effectively.
Ability to work both independently and as part of a collaborative team.
Detail-oriented with excellent organizational skills.
A proactive attitude towards problem-solving and continuous improvement.


Nice-to-Have:


Proficiency in SQL and Python


Why Join Us?

Join us and contribute to driving the success of our operations through insightful analytics and strategic support. If you have the right mix of analytical expertise and communication skills, we would love to hear from you!

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We‚Äôre committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That‚Äôs why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
HTML:
Join us as a (Senior) Data Analyst (m/f/d) in our Fleet Analytics team and help shape the future of autonomous mobility!


At MOIA, you'll be joining the Fleet Analytics team ‚Äì a smart, driven, and fun group of people who care deeply about using data to shape the future of mobility. We're the crew behind the central data foundation for everything fleet-related, and in a world that's moving toward self-driving vehicles, data is at the heart of it all.

We‚Äôre here to make data-informed decision-taking the norm, and we build reliable, scalable data products to support our business needs.

What We Do

  • Work cross-functionally with teams across MOIA to understand diverse data needs
  • Own and evolve the central data framework for our fleet domain
  • Collaborate and challenge each other to improve our data processes and infrastructure
  • Turn complex business questions into clear data models, KPIs, and metrics
  • Help teams meet their analytics goals and keep dashboards accurate and insightful
  • Partner with stakeholders to solve business challenges using data
  • Share knowledge and support teams in adopting and contributing to our central data setup


What you will do

As a (Senior) Data Analyst, you'll empower cross-functional product teams to efficiently leverage data and extract actionable insights for strategic decision-making while driving data-driven product development within MOIA's Fleet OS unit. Your analytical expertise will identify optimization opportunities across our R&D processes while translating complex business requirements into meaningful data products. You'll serve as the critical bridge between raw data and business impact, transforming insights into competitive advantages.


What will help you to fulfill your role

  • Several years of hands-on experience in data analytics;
  • Deep understanding of statistical methods in data analysis (experience with multivariate inferential statistics is a plus);
  • Passion for understanding and analyzing vehicle/fleet operation processes in the exciting field of Autonomous Driving;
  • Proficiency in Python and SQL (experience with DBT is a plus);
  • Use of Cloud Services (AWS, Azure, etc.);
  • Ability to efficiently deliver complex insights to diverse audiences (Product Managers, Project Managers, Senior Leaders, Embedded Engineers, etc.);
  • High level of self-organization and agency in prioritization and decision-making.
  • Proven track record in translating business needs into data products and models;
  • Experience with dashboarding/visualization tools is a plus;
  • Experience with geospatial data is a plus;


We encourage you to apply even if your profile does not meet all the requirements for the role since we are looking for a diverse range of experiences, skills, and interests. We are certain that there will be something for everyone because we are working on such a variety of tasks and embrace individual growth at MOIA.


In case you have questions regarding your application, you can approach the recruiter Dennis directly.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Looking for an exciting challenge?

Mrge is an intelligent platform for commerce advertising, connecting over 5,500 publishers and 55,000 advertisers across 160+ countries. It integrates advanced tools and technologies to bring ads closer to content, creating value for publishers, advertisers, and users. The company combines five leading entities: digidip (premium publishers), MaxBounty (direct partnerships), shopping24 (product recommendations), SourceKnowledge (CPC platform), and Yieldkit (high reach and performance). This collaborative approach enhances advertising effectiveness across various channels and markets.

We‚Äôre looking for a talented and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our growing team at mrge. In this role, you‚Äôll be instrumental in transforming raw data into meaningful insights that inform strategic decisions and enhance customer outcomes. Working closely with engineering, product, and business teams, you‚Äôll refine key data models, develop impactful analyses, and help embed a data-driven culture across the organization.

Your Tasks:


Collaborate with engineering and product teams to monitor, maintain, and optimize business metrics, proactively identifying areas for improvement.
Design and deliver clear, concise reports and dashboards that support strategic planning and performance tracking.
Support the development of forecasting, optimization, and predictive models to inform product and business decisions.
Translate business needs into analytical solutions through close stakeholder collaboration.
Provide strategic insights based on emerging trends and in-depth data analysis.
Contribute to the evolution of our data processes, tooling, and culture as we scale.


Your Profile:


2+ years of experience in data analysis, data science, or analytics engineering.
Advanced SQL skills and strong experience with OLAP databases such as Snowflake, BigQuery, or ClickHouse.
Proficiency in Python for data analysis, including libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, and Jupyter.
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Looker.
Strong foundation in either linear optimization techniques or machine learning for predictive analytics.
Proven ability to turn complex datasets into clear, actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Sharp problem-solving skills and an intuitive understanding of how systems behave in the real world.
Self-starter with the ability to take ownership and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Familiarity with data engineering concepts and workflows is a plus.


Your Opportunity:


Take an active role in shaping an innovative, growth-orientated international corporate group from its early stages; seize the opportunity to become irreplaceable!
Take on responsibility as you become an important part of a young, ambitious, and friendly team with a shared desire to develop its skills.
Enjoy opportunities to work independently, with flexible hours and hybrid remote/office working options.
Enjoy top-notch employee benefits: 30 paid vacation days, the latest tech, individual development plan, prepaid spending card (50‚Ç¨ monthly budget) and much more
Take your skills, talents, and career to the next level as you grow with us.


Have we convinced you? Then we can‚Äôt wait to read your application!

All our employees have equal career opportunities at mrge, regardless of gender, origin, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, age, or other personal attributes.

Candidates will be considered and selected equally based on their skills, qualification, and the needs of the company.

We know that experience and skills are matters of development and gain while working.

Therefore, we encourage you to apply even if your profile does not meet 100% of the requirements for this position.

About Us

A global champion for Commerce Advertising with the vibrant energy of a start-up? A high-tech platform that‚Äôs fun to work with ‚Äì for both employees and clients? A multi-location based company with flat hierarchies, run by an international, multilingual team? Yes, that‚Äôs us! At mrge, we connect publishers, advertisers, smart tools and formats to drive additional revenue. Now we are excited about connecting with you.

Are you ready to grow? Then join us on our mission to expand mrge and its entities digidip, shopping24 and Yieldkit through fresh ideas, great talent and true commitment. We‚Äôre looking forward to getting to know you!

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôve partnered with a market-leading digital business behind some of Europe‚Äôs biggest lottery, charity raffles, and e-commerce gaming platforms ‚Äî combining technology, marketing, and data to reach millions of users across Germany.




They‚Äôre now looking for a Marketing Data Analyst to help elevate how they measure and optimise marketing performance. You‚Äôll lead work on Marketing Mix Models, multi-touch attribution, and incrementality testing ‚Äî helping ensure every euro of media spend is working as hard as it should.




üìç Location: Hamburg / Berlin (Germany-based, 1x/month in office)

Salary: ‚Ç¨60-80k- Dep on Experience!




What You‚Äôll Do

Build and refine MMM and attribution models across all major marketing channels
Run incrementality tests, geo-experiments, and holdouts to measure true impact
Turn data into actionable insights for smarter media planning and budget allocation
Collaborate with teams across CRM, performance, finance, and data engineering
Partner with vendors like Meta and Kantar on measurement and validation
Create dashboards that help teams understand performance and make informed decisions




What We're Looking For

4‚Äì6 years in marketing analytics, ideally in e-commerce or digital consumer products
Strong skills in Python or R, and SQL
Proven experience with MMM, attribution modelling, and performance analysis
Solid grasp of causal inference, experimentation, and regression techniques
Comfortable working across multiple marketing channels
Clear communicator who can explain data to non-technical teams




Sound like your kind of challenge? Apply now!

Title: Senior Data Analyst - People
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Senior Data Analyst - People to join the People & Culture team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

Join the team that champions the employee experience at Delivery Hero. As part of the People & Culture Team, you‚Äôll help attract, develop, and retain top talent, creating a workplace where people feel valued, supported, and empowered to grow. With each initiative you support, you‚Äôll be building a positive culture that fuels innovation, teamwork, and a sense of belonging across our global organization.

You'll collaborate closely with senior business stakeholders, People & Culture Department leaders, and regional P&C teams from across the world, transforming raw data into actionable intelligence. You‚Äôll analyze people data, identify trends, and develop strategies for optimization. Your work will directly impact decision making at Delivery Hero, fueling organizational performance and enhancements in employee experience with the generation of advanced data insights and predictive intelligence. You‚Äôll be a key contributor to improving our operational excellence and strategic planning.


Develop, maintain and improve analytical pipelines to ensure efficient data processing and reporting
Proactively analyze people data to identify trends and establish key performance metrics to monitor areas for improvement and optimization
Partner with stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide actionable insights
Communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders through clear and concise reports and presentations. Translating technical information into digestible content to drive action plans and decision making.
Raise the bar in the data analysis of employees attrition, org design, efficiency drivers, D&I and other key metrics that bring best practices to the People & Culture department.
Drive data literacy training and upskill people partners and other key stakeholders in the use and understanding of people data.


Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or related field).
Strong critical thinking, ability to deep dive and fully understand patterns in data
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to translate data into actionable insights.
Superior storytelling, ability to write clear and engaging executive summaries with the conclusions of the data analysis produced
Strong business acumen and understanding of key concepts of human resources would be a plus
Familiarity with languages and tools for data manipulation, analysis and plotting (R, R-shiny, R-markdown, Scikit, Numpy/Scipy, Pandas, Matplotlib, Bokeh, Jupyter).


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Private equity has always been a sought-after asset class due to its performance potential.

However, steep entry barriers, including high minimum investments (~‚Ç¨10m), hefty paperwork and the challenge of selecting the right fund have traditionally kept individual investors at bay, with access largely limited to big institutions or a select few.

Enter Moonfare.

We've made investing in private equity more accessible and straightforward with our fully digital investment platform. Now, qualified investors can access some of the most sought-after private market funds at lower minimum investment amounts*.

The diverse Moonfare team ‚Äì which includes alumni from top private banks, groundbreaking startups and beyond ‚Äì is united in pushing boundaries and redefining the private equity landscape.

Join us!

Data Analyst (m/f/d)

At Moonfare, we are on a mission to democratise access to top-tier private market investments. As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in driving data informed decision making across the organisation. You'll be part of a small, high impact team that sits at the intersection of data engineering, product, marketing, and commercial, enabling the business through actionable insights, scalable reporting, and high quality data models.

You will shape how we understand performance, measure success, and identify new opportunities across the company. Your work will help ensure that decisions at Moonfare are always backed by clear, well structured, and meaningful data.

You will:


Develop and maintain advanced SQL-based data models to power business reporting and analysis
Build scalable dashboards and self service tools using Tableau, enabling teams across Moonfare to access key metrics and insights
Perform exploratory and strategic analysis to support product launches, marketing campaigns, and commercial initiatives
Partner closely with product managers, marketing, and business stakeholders to understand goals and define relevant KPIs
Lead experimentation efforts including A/B test design, implementation, and interpretation
Advocate for data quality and consistency, ensuring models and reporting are accurate, well documented, and easily understood
Collaborate with the wider data and analytics team to improve data infrastructure and analytics tooling
Drive initiatives that increase data literacy and empower teams to use data more effectively


The next Moonfarian:


Has 5‚Äì7 years of experience as a Data, Product, or Marketing Analyst
Has a proven track record of transforming data infrastructure and metrics to support business growth
Possesses advanced SQL skills (BigQuery, PostgreSQL), along with strong Spreadsheet and Tableau proficiency; experience with dbt and Snowflake is a plus
Has hands-on experience working with commercial, product, or marketing datasets
Is comfortable designing and interpreting A/B tests and leading experimentation efforts
Collaborates effectively across both technical and non-technical teams
Communicates clearly, takes ownership, and is passionate about driving business impact through data


If you feel you do not meet all of the requirements, we still encourage you to apply!

Our Values:


Our clients come first, Moonfare comes second, and we prioritise ourselves third - Client-Centric Focus. Putting clients first means creating value for them is essential. Placing Moonfare second signifies that our individual professional future at Moonfare depends on the company's commercial success. Prioritising ourselves third reflects our humility in putting clients and Moonfare before personal interests.
We pursue excellence and honor our promises - Commitment to Excellence. We hold ourselves to the highest standards, taking responsibility for our failures, and celebrating our successes. We commit to deadlines and stick to them and we learn from our mistakes.
We are here to win and to celebrate our collective achievements - Win together. We are mission-focused and think and act like owners. We exemplify the attitude we expect and each of us commits to do what it takes to succeed.
We foster personal growth but each of us earns our place as a Moonfarian through merit - Growth and Merit. We hire, retain, and develop exceptional people and invest in empowering them to excel. We must all earn our place at the table every day.


We understand the important role that diversity plays in our success. Different backgrounds, experiences and ideas push us further and raise the bar. We're committed to developing an inclusive and safe culture where everyone ‚Äî regardless of colour, race, religion, sex, origin, sexuality, disability, marital status, citizenship or gender identity ‚Äî knows that they are an integral part of the team and can bring their full potential to their work.


Minimum investments vary according to jurisdiction.


Apply now!
Show more
HTML:
Private equity has always been a sought-after asset class due to its performance potential.

However, steep entry barriers, including high minimum investments (~‚Ç¨10m), hefty paperwork and the challenge of selecting the right fund have traditionally kept individual investors at bay, with access largely limited to big institutions or a select few.

Enter Moonfare.

We've made investing in private equity more accessible and straightforward with our fully digital investment platform. Now, qualified investors can access some of the most sought-after private market funds at lower minimum investment amounts*.

The diverse Moonfare team ‚Äì which includes alumni from top private banks, groundbreaking startups and beyond ‚Äì is united in pushing boundaries and redefining the private equity landscape.

Join us!

Data Analyst (m/f/d)

At Moonfare, we are on a mission to democratise access to top-tier private market investments. As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in driving data informed decision making across the organisation. You'll be part of a small, high impact team that sits at the intersection of data engineering, product, marketing, and commercial, enabling the business through actionable insights, scalable reporting, and high quality data models.

You will shape how we understand performance, measure success, and identify new opportunities across the company. Your work will help ensure that decisions at Moonfare are always backed by clear, well structured, and meaningful data.

You will:

  • Develop and maintain advanced SQL-based data models to power business reporting and analysis
  • Build scalable dashboards and self service tools using Tableau, enabling teams across Moonfare to access key metrics and insights
  • Perform exploratory and strategic analysis to support product launches, marketing campaigns, and commercial initiatives
  • Partner closely with product managers, marketing, and business stakeholders to understand goals and define relevant KPIs
  • Lead experimentation efforts including A/B test design, implementation, and interpretation
  • Advocate for data quality and consistency, ensuring models and reporting are accurate, well documented, and easily understood
  • Collaborate with the wider data and analytics team to improve data infrastructure and analytics tooling
  • Drive initiatives that increase data literacy and empower teams to use data more effectively

The next Moonfarian:

  • Has 5‚Äì7 years of experience as a Data, Product, or Marketing Analyst
  • Has a proven track record of transforming data infrastructure and metrics to support business growth
  • Possesses advanced SQL skills (BigQuery, PostgreSQL), along with strong Spreadsheet and Tableau proficiency; experience with dbt and Snowflake is a plus
  • Has hands-on experience working with commercial, product, or marketing datasets
  • Is comfortable designing and interpreting A/B tests and leading experimentation efforts
  • Collaborates effectively across both technical and non-technical teams
  • Communicates clearly, takes ownership, and is passionate about driving business impact through data

If you feel you do not meet all of the requirements, we still encourage you to apply!

Our Values:

  • Our clients come first, Moonfare comes second, and we prioritise ourselves third - Client-Centric Focus. Putting clients first means creating value for them is essential. Placing Moonfare second signifies that our individual professional future at Moonfare depends on the company's commercial success. Prioritising ourselves third reflects our humility in putting clients and Moonfare before personal interests.
  • We pursue excellence and honor our promises - Commitment to Excellence. We hold ourselves to the highest standards, taking responsibility for our failures, and celebrating our successes. We commit to deadlines and stick to them and we learn from our mistakes.
  • We are here to win and to celebrate our collective achievements - Win together. We are mission-focused and think and act like owners. We exemplify the attitude we expect and each of us commits to do what it takes to succeed.
  • We foster personal growth but each of us earns our place as a Moonfarian through merit - Growth and Merit. We hire, retain, and develop exceptional people and invest in empowering them to excel. We must all earn our place at the table every day.

We understand the important role that diversity plays in our success. Different backgrounds, experiences and ideas push us further and raise the bar. We're committed to developing an inclusive and safe culture where everyone ‚Äî regardless of colour, race, religion, sex, origin, sexuality, disability, marital status, citizenship or gender identity ‚Äî knows that they are an integral part of the team and can bring their full potential to their work.

  • Minimum investments vary according to jurisdiction.

Apply now!

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
SoundCloud empowers artists and fans to connect and share through music. Founded in 2007, SoundCloud is an artist-first platform empowering artists to build and grow their careers by providing them with the most progressive tools, services, and resources. With over 400+ million tracks from 40+ million artists, the future of music is SoundCloud.

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will work closely with the product and engineering teams to ensure accurate data capture of the experiences we build and then mine the data to generate insights that drive product innovation and monetization. You will use your advanced SQL skills, analytical mindset, and storytelling abilities to uncover user behavior patterns, identify opportunities, and measure the impact of new features/functionality through experimentation. You will also create dashboards and insights reports to communicate your findings and recommendations to various stakeholders, from product managers and engineers to leadership and executives.

Drawing on your strong commercial sense, you‚Äôll partner across functions to shape product and go‚Äëto‚Äëmarket decisions that fuel the expansion of our content ecosystem.

Key Responsibilities


Leverage content economics and user behavior data to recommend the right tracks and creators to listeners, define and track KPIs for subscriptions and other revenue streams, and pinpoint opportunities to optimize spend and boost ROI.
Conduct exploratory data analysis to identify the opportunity space for the product teams based on user needs, preferences, pain points & friction in the user journeys.
Lead the charge on hypothesis‚Äëdriven testing; creating the infrastructure that fast‚Äëtracks experiments on content curation, listener experience, and interface enhancements to maximize growth.
Communicate data-driven insights & recommendations to product, engineering, design, and leadership teams using clear and compelling narratives, visualizations, and presentations.
Collaborate with other analysts, data engineers, data scientists, and product managers to ensure data quality, consistency, and alignment across different data sources and platforms
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and documentation to share best practices, learnings, and institutional knowledge across the organization.


Background And Experience


5+ years of experience in product analytics, business intelligence, data science, or a related field. Direct experience within Commerce, subscriptions, freemium based businesses, streaming services, Social, Commerce, Gaming is a plus.
Expertise in SQL and experience working with large-scale data sets on cloud platforms such as GCP or AWS.
Experience with analytics engineering tools such as Apache Airflow, Dataform, dbt, etc.
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau, or Power BI.
Familiarity with event tracking, design and tag management solutions such as Segment, GTM, Adobe Launch, Tealium, etc.
Experience in designing, running, and analyzing complex A/B tests and experiments using one or more of the leading experimentation solutions. i.e. StatSig / Optimizely / Target.
Strong analytical skills and ability to apply statistical methods such as hypothesis testing, regression analysis, clustering, forecasting. Experience building churn and retention prediction models
Excellent communication skills and ability to translate complex data into actionable insights and recommendations for different audiences.
Curiosity and passion to find & elevate the data narratives and exercise influence to drive change.
Experience in mentoring and training analysts and non technical stakeholders
Passion for music and interest in understanding user behavior and preferences in the music domain.


About Us


We are a multinational company with offices in the US (New York and Los Angeles), Germany (Berlin), and the UK (London)
We provide a flexible work culture that offers the opportunity to collaborate and connect in person at our offices as well as accommodating work from home
We are deeply committed to ensuring diversity, equity and inclusion at all levels of our organization and fostering a community where everyone‚Äôs voice, perspective and experience is respected and heard
We believe a strong team is made by investing in employees through mentorship, workshops and enrichment opportunities


Benefits


Not located in Berlin? No worries, we offer extensive relocation support including allowances, one way flights, temporary accommodation and, by partnering with Expath, on the ground support on arrival
Interested in a gym membership, photography course or book? We have a Creativity and Wellness benefit!
Employee Equity Plan
Generous professional development allowance
Fertility and Family Building program
Flexible vacation and public holiday policy where you can take up to 35 days of PTO annually
We offer free German courses at beginning, intermediate and advanced
Various snacks, goodies, and 2 free lunches weekly when at the office


Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at SoundCloud

SoundCloud is for everyone. Diversity and open expression are fundamental to our organization; they help us lead what‚Äôs next in music by understanding and empowering our creators and fans, no matter their identity. We acknowledge the challenges in the music industry, and strive to influence an inclusive culture where everyone can contribute respectfully and thrive, especially the historically marginalized communities that many of our creators, fans and SoundClouders identify with. We are dedicated to creating an inclusive environment at SoundCloud for everyone, regardless of gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, migration background, national origin, age, disability status, or care-giver status.

At SoundCloud you can find your community or elevate your allyship by joining a Diversity Resource Group. Diversity Resource Groups are employee-organized groups focused on supporting and promoting the interests of a particular underrepresented community in order to build a more inclusive culture at SoundCloud. Anyone can join, whether you share the identity or strive to be an ally.

We are dedicated to creating an inclusive environment at SoundCloud for everyone, regardless of gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, migration background, national origin, age, disability status, or care-giver status.

At SoundCloud you can find your community or elevate your allyship by joining a Diversity Resource Group. Diversity Resource Groups are employee-organized groups focused on supporting and promoting the interests of a particular underrepresented community in order to build a more inclusive culture at SoundCloud. Anyone can join, whether you share the identity or strive to be an ally.

Title: Sales Data Analyst (Part-Time)
Description:
Lovehoney Group is the world‚Äôs leading sexual wellbeing company, with the mission to elevate pleasure through innovative technologies, a data-driven approach, and foster creative and fresh perspectives on intimacy. We offer exciting brands with innovative, high-quality sex toys, lingerie, and accessories in a streamlined online shopping experience.

At Lovehoney, we employ over 800 passionate and progressive individuals across 9 global offices, each person contributing a unique blend of talents to our diverse workforce. We are proud to be a company that thrives by doing things differently, challenging expectations and stereotypes while making a positive impact on our customers‚Äô lives.

Join us at Lovehoney, where pleasure combines with creativity, data, and innovation!

We are currently looking for a part-time Data Analyst to join our team. This role is ideal for someone highly analytical and detail-oriented, who enjoys working with data sets, developing insights, and driving data-informed decisions. You‚Äôll provide actionable insights through meticulous data analysis, supporting strategic decision-making across teams.

What You Will Do


Collect, compile, and clean large and varied data sets, ensuring their accuracy and reliability.
Develop, maintain, and optimize comprehensive reporting dashboards using analytical tools like Superset and Netsuite.
Conduct in-depth data analyses to identify meaningful trends, patterns, and insights.
Collaborate with various internal teams to ensure accurate and insightful reporting that informs strategic decision-making.
Continuously enhance data quality, reporting processes, and analytic methodologies.



What You Should Bring


Experience in data analysis or related data-centric roles. A great benefit if related with sales.
Proficiency in data management, analysis, and visualization; familiarity with Superset and Netsuite is a strong plus.
Strong analytical capabilities, with demonstrated experience in interpreting complex data.
Attention to detail with the ability to ensure high accuracy and clarity in reporting.
Excellent communication skills, capable of translating data insights clearly to different stakeholders.



What We Can Offer You


A welcoming workplace full of drinks, snacks, friendly faces and fun team-building events
Access to unique discounts at high street retailers, hotels, and service providers, in addition to a 50% discount on all Lovehoney products to explore and discover new ways to have fun
Enjoy a hybrid work model that fosters flexibility and work-life balance, with three days per week in-office and the opportunity to work remotely for up to 4 weeks per year, alongside 25 days‚Äô holiday, plus an additional day for each year you are with Lovehoney, providing ample time for relaxation, rejuvenation, and exploration
Access to customized training opportunities to support your unique learning journey, complemented by biannual feedback cycles, offering valuable insights into your performance and growth areas, enhancing your development within the company.
Recognising the significance of physical and mental health, we proudly provide gym benefits in addition to a mental wellbeing platform, to ensure our employees thrive both professionally and personally.



Our interview process


CV review
Interview with one of Talent Acquisition Team Members
Hiring Manager Interview
Task
Hiring Team Interview



Lovehoney Group is an equal opportunities employer. We promise that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

If you require accommodations during the interview process due to a disability, please inform your Talent Acquisition Specialist so that we can ensure a smooth and inclusive experience for all candidates.

At Lovehoney Group, we embrace innovative technologies to enhance our recruitment process. As part of your application, you'll experience practical, AI-driven tasks designed to reflect real scenarios you'll encounter in the role, helping us understand your strengths and approach. Additionally, we leverage artificial intelligence during screening interviews for CV reviews and note-taking. We prioritize transparency and respect your preferences, so you'll have the option to opt out of recording and AI-driven note-taking while still receiving full and fair consideration for the role.

We currently have a hybrid work model supporting a blend of in-office and remote work (3 days per week in-office)

If we sparked your interest and you are open to embarking on your professional path with us, please visit our Lovehoney careers page to apply: https://jobs.eu.lever.co/lovehoneygroup

Our privacy policy is available here: https://www.lovehoneygroup.com/privacy-policy/

Controlling, Asset-, Portfolio- und Risikomanagement) optimierst und digitalisierst du Prozesse zur Datenerhebung und zum Datenaustausch.

Du nimmst Anforderungen auf, priorisierst sie, koordinierst die Umsetzung mit externen Partnern und begleitest den gesamten Ver√§nderungsprozess ‚Äì inklusive der Auswahl neuer Tools.
Wissensvermittlung & Support: Du schulst unsere Anwender*innen auf Deutsch und Englisch im Umgang mit Datenschnittstellen und komplexen Excel-Kalkulationsmodellen und stehst ihnen als Support zur Seite.
Strategische Mitgestaltung: Du wirkst aktiv an der strategischen Ausrichtung der Daten- und Anwendungslandschaft im Unternehmen mit.


Das √ºberzeugt uns


Technische Expertise: Du bringst fundierte Kenntnisse in relationalen Datenbanken und Data-Warehouse-Technologien mit ‚Äì idealerweise im Umgang mit MS SQL Server und MS Data Fabric ‚Äì sowie in Python. Mit Visualisierungstools wie Power BI oder Tableau und den MS-Office-Anwendungen, insbesondere Excel und Power Query, gehst du sicher um. Erste Erfahrungen in Cloud-Umgebungen (z.‚ÄØB. Azure) sind von Vorteil.
Methodische Kompetenz: Du hast eine Leidenschaft f√ºr Daten und Prozesse. Deine Arbeitsweise zeichnet sich durch ausgepr√§gte analytische und konzeptionelle F√§higkeiten aus. Idealerweise hast du bereits Erfahrung in der agilen Projektarbeit, z.‚ÄØB. mit Scrum oder Kanban.
Kommunikationsst√§rke: Als kommunikativer Teamplayer arbeitest du erfolgreich mit internen Fachbereichen und externen Dienstleistern zusammen. Du kommunizierst sicher und flie√üend auf Deutsch (mindestens C1-Niveau) und Englisch.
Qualifikation: Du verf√ºgst √ºber einen Hochschulabschluss in einem MINT-Fach (Mathematik, Informatik, Naturwissenschaften, Technik) oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation durch mehrj√§hrige, relevante Berufserfahrung im IT- oder Datenumfeld. Deine hohe IT-Affinit√§t erm√∂glicht dir eine schnelle Einarbeitung in neue Systeme.


Das kannst du von uns erwarten

Unsere Philosophie: Unternehmergeist und Menschlichkeit vereint. Bei uns legen wir neben der fachlichen Kompetenz ebenso gro√üen Wert auf die individuelle Pers√∂nlichkeit jedes Einzelnen. Entdecke eine Arbeitsumgebung, die mehr als nur einen Job bietet: Art-Invest Real Estate | Unsere Arbeitswelt

  • Kommunikationsst√§rke: Als kommunikativer Teamplayer arbeitest du erfolgreich mit internen Fachbereichen und externen Dienstleistern zusammen. Du kommunizierst sicher und flie√üend auf Deutsch (mindestens C1-Niveau) und Englisch.
  • Qualifikation: Du verf√ºgst √ºber einen Hochschulabschluss in einem MINT-Fach (Mathematik, Informatik, Naturwissenschaften, Technik) oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation durch mehrj√§hrige, relevante Berufserfahrung im IT- oder Datenumfeld. Deine hohe IT-Affinit√§t erm√∂glicht dir eine schnelle Einarbeitung in neue Systeme.

Das kannst du von uns erwarten

Unsere Philosophie: Unternehmergeist und Menschlichkeit vereint. Bei uns legen wir neben der fachlichen Kompetenz ebenso gro√üen Wert auf die individuelle Pers√∂nlichkeit jedes Einzelnen. Entdecke eine Arbeitsumgebung, die mehr als nur einen Job bietet: Art-Invest Real Estate | Unsere Arbeitswelt

Title: AI Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM


The Operations & Analytics team partners with stakeholders across Merchandising, Buying, Operations, and Products Quality & Safety to inform timely, quality decisions about Zalando‚Äôs business with its suppliers. We enable commercial decisions, process improvements, standardisation, and workflow automation.

Are you excited about challenging the status quo, pushing the boundaries, and leveraging data and AI to shape the future of fashion and lifestyle e-commerce? This is your chance!

As an AI Data Analyst, you will take your analytical expertise to the next level, leveraging cutting-edge tech tools to define and track KPIs, explore data sources, analyse complex datasets, and solve critical business problems. You will be part of the world-class Analytics@Zalando community that offers various opportunities to network and share knowledge and best practices.


WHAT WE‚ÄôD LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)


This is where analytical expertise meets excellence to empower our stakeholders to make timely quality business decisions!



Forge trusted partnerships where stakeholders seek your strategic insights, not just your SQL skills. Immerse yourself in your business partners' world to understand their pain points and effectively translate their business questions into analytical problems. By proactively identifying opportunities where data can unlock value and delivering insights that shape decisions, you'll earn a seat at the table where your recommendations directly influence Zalando‚Äôs strategy.
Build the foundations for trusted self-service analytics at scale by designing, developing, and maintaining data transformation pipelines and AI models throughout their lifecycle that business stakeholders can confidently adopt, earning trust through data quality and empowerment, enabling stakeholders to independently answer their frequently asked business questions while you tackle more complex analyses and strategic challenges.
Design and develop game-changing AI-powered applications to streamline and automate processes and workflows to enable Zalando‚Äôs business growth, improve customer and supplier experience, drive operational efficiency, and maximise profitability.
Actively participate in architecture discussions with engineering teams and senior colleagues in analytics and tech, evaluate trade-offs, and make sound recommendations.




WE‚ÄôD LOVE TO MEET YOU IF




You hold a Master‚Äôs in Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, or a similar field and gained 5+ years of professional experience in data analytics or data science.
You have proven experience designing, building, and maintaining scalable data pipelines using SQL and Python on cloud data warehouses and lakehouses (ideally, AWS Redshift and Databricks), with strong knowledge of orchestration tools (dbt and Apache Airflow).
You are proficient in data visualisation best practices and tools (Tableau, Looker, or MicroStrategy) and have exceptional data storytelling abilities to effectively communicate complex technical concepts and actionable insights to diverse audiences.
You have hands-on experience with statistical analysis and machine learning techniques (regression, classification, clustering), practical GenAI applications, and successfully deployed solutions in production environments.
You uphold rigorous software engineering standards in version control (Git/GitHub), CI/CD pipelines (Jenkins/GitHub Actions), and code documentation best practices.
You exhibit intellectual curiosity and critical thinking to amplify your business impact through strategic integration of AI in your analytics workflows and rigorous evaluation of its output.
You show demonstrated ability to develop profound business understanding, proactively identify opportunities, effectively manage priorities and stakeholders‚Äô expectations, translate business questions into concrete analytical problems, bring industry trends and best practices to the conversation, and make sound data-backed recommendations.




OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits, here‚Äôs an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with up to 60% remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year to start
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counseling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching available
Drive your development through our training platform and biannual peer-to-peer review



Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us

Title: Data Analyst, Client Onboarding
Description:
Work Location: Berlin or Amsterdam

Are you a skilled Python and SQL user with a strong analytical background? Are you passionate about uncovering insights within data and applying them to real-world financial challenges? Then you might just be the Data Analyst we're looking for!

Your primary responsibilities will be:


Manage the end-to-end process of data-driven knowledge gathering (connect, mine, simulate, predict, illustrate, and deploy)
Create data-based solutions to address complex business challenges
Set up long-term dashboarding and tracking to monitor key metrics
Conduct A/B tests to evaluate and optimize business decisions
Perform deep-dives into socio-economic factors and distribution channels to uncover actionable insights


What we're looking for:


Solid analytical skills (you're a natural problem solver)
Proficiency in Python and SQL (you can write advanced queries with ease)
Solid statistical & technical foundation (e.g., A/B Testing, hypothesis testing) with a self-driven and proactive attitude
Strong verbal and written communication skills (you can explain complex ideas in simple terms)
Focus on quality (you strive for excellence in everything you do)
Knowledge of financial markets & financial products (options, futures, etc.)


What we offer:


Competitive Salary, depending on your educational level and work experience
Free lunch from our cook, fresh juices & fruit
Continuous growth potential and a training budget of ‚Ç¨2,000 per year
Trips & activities with your colleagues
Relaxed and informal working environment
Discount for membership of the Urban Sports Club
Additional contribution to the company pension scheme
In-house German and English courses with a native speaker and cover half of the costs


About us:

LYNX helps you invest in yourself"

"Working at LYNX means joining the LYNX family"

"The development opportunities make LYNX the best place to work"

This is what the employees say about LYNX and it is exactly what we want to offer: a work environment where you can get the best out of yourself. At our office in the heart of Amsterdam, Ghent, Berlin and Prague, we work every day to offer both private and professional clients the best trading opportunities, with a fast, user-friendly and reliable trading platform.

The best choice for anyone who takes investing seriously:

LYNX is an international FinTech that offers you a relaxed and informal work environment, where you can get the best out of yourself and where 300 people contribute together to the success of our customers since 2006.

In 2006 LYNX entered the investor market with two spearheads: very low rates and an extensive product range. This makes the online broker not only successful in the Netherlands, but also abroad. After opening offices in Belgium, Germany and the Czech Republic, LYNX now offers its services in ten different countries, making it a European broker of size.

In 2019 the product of LYNX, and therefore the offer for investors, has been greatly improved. For example, a highly advanced mobile and tablet app is available, the LYNX Masterclass webinars can be watched weekly via the Knowledge Portal, and thanks to the Morning Call, investors are quickly daily informed about the latest news on the financial markets.

Title: Claims Data Analyst/Business Analyst. Healthcare
Description:
Trinetix is seeking analytical and healthcare-savvy Claims Data Analyst / Business Analyst to support projects focused on payer and provider data systems, RCM (Revenue Cycle Management) processes, and data-driven automation initiatives. This role requires a deep understanding of claims data, industry-standard data formats (e.g., 837/835), and the broader healthcare data ecosystem.

The ideal candidate is technology-agnostic, adaptable, and capable of working across systems to analyze trends, identify process gaps, and help implement automated, scalable solutions in healthcare operations.

Requirements


5+ years of experience in a data analysis or business analysis role with a strong focus on claims data.
Solid understanding of 837/835 transaction sets, CPT/ICD coding, adjudication logic, and revenue cycle workflows.
Proven experience working across both payer and provider data systems and data exchange models understanding.
Experience gathering requirements, writing documentation, and conducting business process analysis in healthcare environments.
Familiarity with data querying (SQL) and BI/reporting tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker).
Understanding of HIPAA and healthcare data privacy and compliance regulations.


Nice-to-haves


Exposure to FHIR, HL7, or healthcare data interoperability standards.
Experience supporting RCM automation or process improvement projects (e.g., using bots, scripts, or custom workflows).
Familiarity with cloud-based healthcare data platforms or data lakes.
Experience working with clinical and claims data integration use cases.
Bachelor's degree in Healthcare Informatics, Business, Data Science, or a related field.


Core Responsibilities


Develop new features
Analyze requirements and clarify with BSA
Participate in grooming, estimation, and planning sessions
Collaborate with other team members (FE, QA, TDM, BSA, Architect)
Support existing functionality, refactoring, and bug-fixing


Soft Skills


Strong communication and stakeholder engagement skills.
Analytical mindset with attention to detail and data integrity.
Ability to navigate ambiguity and translate complex business needs into clear, actionable requirements.
Collaborative, self-motivated, and solution-oriented.


Why Join Us?


Contribute to meaningful projects that improve healthcare financial operations and data quality.
Work alongside healthcare experts, engineers, and innovators in a dynamic, agile environment.
Be part of a mission-driven team focused on modernizing healthcare data ecosystems. Opportunities for growth, leadership, and cross-functional collaboration


About Us

Established in 2011, Trinetix is a dynamic tech service provider supporting enterprise clients around the world.

Headquartered in Nashville, Tennessee, we have a global team of over 1,000 professionals and delivery centers across Europe, the United States, and Argentina. We partner with leading global brands, delivering innovative digital solutions across Fintech, Professional Services, Logistics, Healthcare, and Agriculture.

Our operations are driven by a strong business vision, a people-first culture, and a commitment to responsible growth. We actively give back to the community through various CSR activities and adhere to international principles for sustainable development and business ethics.

To learn more about how we collect, process, and store your personal data, please review our Privacy Notice: https://www.trinetix.com/corporate-policies/privacy-notice

Title: PowerBI Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Zusammenfassung: Diese Position erfordert die enge Zusammenarbeit mit technischen Projekten, um Reporting-Bed√ºrfnisse zu verstehen und in intelligente, effektive Dashboard-L√∂sungen umzusetzen. Der Hauptzweck der Rolle besteht darin, Projekt- und programmspezifische Power BI-Dashboards kontinuierlich zu entwickeln und zu verbessern.

Aufgaben:


Enge Zusammenarbeit mit technischen Projekten zur Ermittlung von Reporting-Bed√ºrfnissen
Analyse bestehender Datenquellen und Entwicklung von Strukturierungsmethoden f√ºr Reporting
Kombination von Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen (z. B. Cloud-Plattformen, Excel, APIs) und Vorbereitung f√ºr die Nutzung in Power BI
Erstellung und Pflege benutzerfreundlicher, projektspezifischer Dashboards
Einrichtung und Verbesserung der Datenladeprozesse zur automatischen Aktualisierung der Dashboards
Unterst√ºtzung von Kollegen durch Schulung und Anleitung zur Nutzung der Power BI-Dashboards


Must Haves:

Title: Data Analyst (Marketing & CRM Focus)
Description:
Blinkist connects people with powerful ideas from leading authors and experts to broaden perspectives, gain knowledge, and spark understanding in all areas of their life, both personal and professional.

Used by over 32 million people worldwide, Blinkist distills the key ideas from the most relevant, impactful books and podcasts. These can be read or listened to in 15-minute summaries, that we call Blinks. ‚ú®

About The Role

We're looking for a Data Analyst with a passion for data-driven decision-making to join our team. In this role, you'll design, develop, optimize and finally use data transformation pipelines to derive actionable insights that drive business impact. For us, data is a means to an end: Making better decisions together with the business stakeholders and help them achieve better results.

Please note this is a 1-year limited contract position.

Check out the hiring process for this position here: https://jobs.blinkist.com/vm4 üöÄ

What You'll Do


Drive Conversion Strategy: Partner with the CRM team to analyze user behavior, identify conversion opportunities, and design data-driven campaigns that move free users to paid subscriptions and paid users to enterprise accounts.
Campaign Design & Execution: Go beyond analysis‚Äîactively participate in campaign planning, A/B test design, and optimization strategies. Your insights will directly shape how we engage our users.
User Lifecycle Analytics: Build a deep understanding of user journeys, identify drop-off points, and create actionable recommendations that improve conversion rates at every stage.
Performance Optimization: Monitor campaign performance, conduct post-campaign analysis, and iterate on strategies. Turn data into clear action items that drive measurable business results.
Stakeholder Partnership: Work closely with marketing, product, and CRM teams to align data insights with business objectives. Translate complex analysis into clear, actionable recommendations.


What We're Looking For


Data Enthusiasm: You have a passion for clean, well-structured data and the curiosity to explore and find impactful solutions.
Strong SQL Skills: You write SQL like a second language, with experience building complex queries and optimizing performance.
Hands-on Experience with dbt: You've successfully used dbt to build and maintain data pipelines, ensuring data is reliable and accessible.
You want to achieve results, together: You want to see the outcome of your work. You're not afraid to deprioritize "busy-work" and you love to succeed as a team.
Business Impact Mindset: You approach technical challenges with a focus on driving business results and solving real-world problems.
Collaborative Spirit: You thrive in team settings, working with others to align on goals and deliver results.
Growth Mindset: You embrace challenges, learn quickly, and seek opportunities to grow personally and professionally.

Great to Haves:


Experience with CRM platforms (especially Braze) and marketing automation tools
A/B testing and experimentation experience
Familiarity with user behavior analytics tools
Understanding of subscription business models and enterprise sales


Why Blinkist

Our unique culture of empowerment, mutual respect, and transparency has always been our defining characteristic. We support each other and carve out opportunities for every individual to develop and grow. We strongly believe that diversity powers innovation, thus we celebrate and support our differences, providing equal opportunities for employment and career growth. We embrace a flexible, remote-friendly way of working that supports different needs and lifestyles.

These are some of our most valued benefits:


30 PTO days + Wellbeing days + Learning days
Flexible approach to work, including from abroad
Monthly transport allowance
One-time work from home office set up budget
Professional development fund
Family planning & parental leave, plus support for parents returning to work
Wellness initiatives and an Employee Assistance Program


If you choose to join our team in Berlin, you'll have access to our modern office space in Neuk√∂lln and enjoy healthy plant-based meals prepared fresh every day by our very own chef. ü•ë

Apply Now

If we've captured your interest and you want to take part in changing the world through the power of ideas, apply now and tell us what excited you about this opportunity.

We look forward to hearing from you! ‚òÄÔ∏è

üîé Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalised folks tend to only apply when they check every box. If you think you have what it takes, even if you don't meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch. We'd love to review your application and see if you could be a great fit.

Information on how we process your personal data can be found in our Privacy Policy: Blinkist Privacy Policy (English) / Blinkist Privacy Policy (German)

Title: Data Analyst - Product (d/f/m)
Description:
Our Story

Every year millions of people are either filing their taxes in fear or giving up on their tax refund altogether. We're working on fixing that. Our intuitive app enables anyone, regardless of education or background, to file their taxes with newfound confidence.

Spread across Germany, Spain and the UK, the team at Taxfix Group with its brands Taxfix, Steuerbot and TaxScouts, is a compassionate group of solution-finders. We speak our minds openly, and with over 400 professionals, including tax experts, developers, and IT security experts, we're rich in ideas and voices. The group has facilitated more than 3.5 billion euros in tax refunds for its customers since its founding in 2016

Your Challenge

As a Data Analyst in our Product Analytics team, you will play a key role in shaping data-informed decision-making across multiple mission teams.

Partnering with Product Managers, Engineers, Designers, and other cross-functional stakeholders, you will use data to uncover insights about user behavior across both our customer-facing products and internal tools.

Your work will involve designing and building reports, analyzing feature performance, generating actionable insights that drive product improvements, and contributing to a robust data foundation by helping define and structure the right tracking and data capture.

Your Responsibilities


Analyze user behavior and product usage to uncover trends, pain points, and opportunities.
Define and track key product metrics to measure feature performance and business impact.
Translate complex data into clear, compelling narratives and share insights with a range of stakeholders.
Build dashboards to enable self-serve analytics across the organization, and also up-skill your stakeholders.
Collaborate with the Analytics Engineering to improve our data sources and self-serve solution.


Your Profile


2+ years of experience in a data analytics role, ideally within a product or tech environment
Ability to translate complex data into clear insights and actionable recommendations.
Good communication skills and ability to work with stakeholders across all levels.
Excellent SQL skills.
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Mixpanel, Tableau).
Keen interest in AI‚Äôs potential, paired with hands-on experimentation and solid conceptual understanding of generative-AI tools.


Nice To Have


Experience with A/B testing and Python are plus.
Data modelling and dbt knowledge are a plus.


Why Taxfix?


A chance to do meaningful, people-centric work with an international team of passionate professionals.
Holistic well-being with free mental health coaching sessions and yoga.
A monthly allowance to spend on an extensive range of services that you can use and roll over as flexibly as you like.
Employee stock options for all employees‚Äîbecause everyone deserves to benefit from the success they help to create.
30 annual vacation days and flexible working hours.
A generous learning budget to support your personal and professional development and guidance from our internal L&D experts.
Work from abroad for up to six weeks every year. Just align with your team, and then enjoy your trip.
Plenty of opportunities to socialise as a team. In addition to internal tech meetups, our international team hosts regular get-togethers‚Äîvirtually and in person when possible.
Free tax declaration filing, of course, through the Taxfix app‚Äîand internal support for all personal tax-related questions.
Have a four-legged friend in your life? We‚Äôre happy to have dogs join us in the office.


Excited? So are we. Learn more about Team Taxfix on our blog and get a glimpse of our culture.

At Taxfix, we believe that incredible things happen when you have a wealth of perspectives and experiences. We're proudly committed to equal employment and development opportunities no matter your gender, race, religion, age, sexual orientation, colour, disability, or place of origin. To help mitigate any potential unconscious biases, we ask that you refrain from including your picture, age, or marital status on your CV. Let your experiences speak for themselves.

Not sure if you meet all the requirements for this role? Please apply anyway. You might bring something special to the team that we hadn't considered previously.

Not sure if you meet all the requirements for this role? Please apply anyway. You might bring something special to the team that we hadn't considered previously.

Title: Lead Data Strategist (BI & Analytics) (m/f/d)
Description:
About getolo:

Founded in 2015, getolo GmbH is an innovative and award-winning InsurTech company that offers comprehensive supplementary insurance plans in the areas of dental, pet health and liability, as well as health add-on coverage. Under the brands dentolo, petolo, and vitolo, we serve over 200,000 customers in Germany and France, providing digital and hassle-free protection that seamlessly integrates into their daily lives.

We believe that prevention is always better than cure‚Äîwhich is why we focus on preventive care, customer-centric service, and financial security to protect our customers and their loved ones from unexpected costs. Thanks to the close collaboration of our team of market specialists and insurance experts, we continuously monitor industry developments to offer practical solutions for current challenges.

getolo's company culture is built on collaboration, innovation, and agility‚Äîalways with a strong focus on the needs of our customers. With a team of around 200 employees, getolo is led by Daniel Gadea (CEO) and Laura Wulff (CGO). getolo is a partner of DA Direkt and part of the Zurich Group Germany.

We are seeking a strategic and results-driven Lead Data Strategist (BI & Analytics) (m/f/d) to define and drive a company-wide reporting and dashboarding strategy that focuses on actionable insights. Are you ready for a new challenge in a rapidly developing insurtech? Look no further‚ò∫Ô∏è

Your role in a team:

BI & Reporting Strategy


Define and drive a company-wide reporting and dashboarding strategy that focuses on actionable insights
Support in maintaining and developing our self-service landscape and improve data literacy across our company
Identify and eliminate redundant or low-impact reports; streamline and standardize KPI definitions across teams


Business Prioritization & Data Strategy


Act as a sparring partner to the Data Platform Lead to prioritize data sources and models based on business needs and strategic goals
Translate business requirements into clear data needs and help shape the data roadmap
Ensure alignment between data infrastructure and use cases across departments


Analytics Enablement & Coaching


Mentor and upskill Business Analysts in Sales, Marketing, and Ops, helping them grow their analytical capabilities and storytelling with data
Create best practices for dashboard creation, metric consistency, and interpretation of results
Facilitate a knowledge-sharing culture across analysts and ensure alignment in tooling and methodology


Strategic Data Projects


Enabling leadership with data-driven insights (e.g. customer segmentation, growth modeling, churn analysis)
Serve as a strategic advisor to the Management and leadership team on critical business questions, using data to guide high-impact decisions
Lead cross-functional, strategic initiatives like integrating new markets into our reporting landscape or supporting pricing and product analytics for new insurance products


What you need to be successful:


5-8 years of experience in analytics, business intelligence, or data strategy roles ‚Äî ideally in high-growth tech, SaaS, or digital business environments
Proven track record of owning company-wide reporting or BI initiatives, including defining KPI frameworks and improving dashboard ecosystems
Experience working closely with leadership or C-level on strategic, data-driven decisions (e.g., pricing, market expansion, customer segmentation)
Strong ability to translate business questions into data needs, and partner with data engineering or platform teams on model requirements
Hands-on experience with modern BI tools (e.g., Looker, Metabase, Tableau, Power BI) and SQL proficiency for self-service analytics
Prior mentoring or informal leadership of analysts or cross-functional stakeholders; ideally experience establishing analytics standards or processes
Familiarity with data governance, definitions, and source documentation, even if not responsible for pipelines or ETL
Bonus: exposure to insurance, healthtech, or regulated environments, or experience supporting pricing and underwriting teams
dbt knowledge would be a plus
Native or C2 English, German would be a plus
Berlin-based


Why getolo?

üå¥ Salary & Vacation


Attractive fixed salary
Start with 28 vacation days, with an increase every two years (capped at 30 days). Holidays on December 24th and 31st. 2 community days to support a charity organisation of your choice


üßë‚Äçüíª Mobility & Flexibility


Choose between a free Swapfiets bike, a BVG ticket ("Umweltticket") or a "Deutschlandticket" subsidized by us
Work hybrid - from your home office or in our office in Berlin-Mitte
Work abroad in the EU for up to 60 days


üßò Health


Benefit from free coaching sessions with nilo.health, our mental health tool
Test our products yourself! Choose between dentolo, petolo or vitolo


üìö Development


Training budget starting from 750 ‚Ç¨ per year
Regular (360 degree) feedback


üôå And much more...


Legendary summer and winter parties
Regular team events
Many discounts on the corporate Benefits Platform
Pet friendly office


Sounds like the perfect job for you? We look forward to receiving your application and getting to know you!

getolo is an equal opportunity and diversity employer. We strive to create a friendly, safe, and welcoming environment for all our team members, regardless of ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, limitations and talents of any kind, physical appearance, social background, marital status, age, or religion (or lack thereof).

When you apply, we focus solely on your experience and motivation. You decide what additional information you want to disclose (photo, marital status, religion, gender, nationality, etc.). We value and treat all applications equally.

Contact:

Katia Minukhina

Talent Acquisition Manager

jobs@getolo.com

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/x) Customer Success
Description:
Job Description

We at sevDesk:As an intuitive cloud accounting software, we empower founders, self-employed individuals, and small business owners to focus on what truly matters. Our product offers them a smart accounting tool to save time in their daily activities. As a company, we aim for excellence, continuously expand our horizons, and strive for daily improvement of our product and our daily work life. In pursuit of these goals, we rely on our strong culture, innovative spirit, and unwavering passion. In the future, we hope to count you among our dedicated team members.

Your mission:

You are an analytical consultant for the data- and insights-driven development of our Customer Success Team. With your analysis, you identify optimization potential in the organization and influence our Customer Service and Support roadmap with your recommendations for action.

Here's how you'll make an impact:


You analyze user behavior data and use it to support our Customer Success Teams in optimizing customer retention and identifying the most critical customer problems.
You collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to analyze customer-journey touchpoints to continuously improve how our customers interact with our software.
You scrutinize our Service & Support activities, detect shifts in KPI performance, and, in partnership with your stakeholders, translate the findings into data-driven hypotheses and actionable recommendations.
You prepare your findings visually so that it is easy for your stakeholders to incorporate them into their decisions.
You design optimizations in data collection and continuously develop the reporting ecosystem.
You support your colleagues in using product data and help keep our quality standards high with peer reviews
Reporting and analyzing churn prevention activities, onboarding flows, and the impact of customer communications to help the teams boost engagement and retention.


Your Qualification:


You have at least 3 years of experience as a Data Analyst (m/f/x), preferably in a digital and/or SaaS environment.
You speak German (at least B2) and English (C1)
You have a degree in (business) informatics, economics, (business) mathematics or comparable.
You have experience using data to drive impact, including working with tools such as SQL, Tableau, Looker, Snowflake, Redshift, or comparable platforms.
You have relevant experience in the conception and evaluation of A/B tests, good knowledge of statistics is a plus.
You are proactive, results-oriented, and flexible in problem-solving both in your role and for the company.
Your profile is rounded off by strong communication, presentation, and organizational skills.
Despite your passion for data, you recognize that emotions are not always quantifiable, so you actively seek direct dialogue with our users to capture qualitative insights.


__

Our Techstack:

SQL | Snowflake | Snowplow | dbt | Python | Looker | Metabase | Mixpanel

Job Requirements

Your sevdesk Experience

Drive Impact: Make meaningful contributions and help move initiatives forward across teams. Your input will be valued, and your work will have a direct influence on sevdesk's success.

Empowered Ownership: take charge of your work and projects with the expectation of making decisions independently, supported by a team that's there when you need guidance.

Competitive Compensation: Includes a stock option plan and company pension to reward your contributions.

Time to Recharge: 30 vacation days, 3 additional days for social engagement, plus 30 Workation days to work from anywhere in the EU.

Flexible Work Environment: We believe in working where you‚Äôre most productive, whether that‚Äôs at home or in the office. Our hybrid approach balances flexibility with in-person collaboration, fostering trust and strong teamwork when we come together.

Comprehensive Benefits: learning budget, bike leasing, monthly voucher of choice (Amazon, IKEA, Car Sharing, ‚Ä¶), Amazon book flat, corporate discounts and more.

Team Vibes: Enjoy regular team offsites and quarterly events packed with networking and fun!

For more insights, visit us on Instagram



Contact:‚ÄØ‚ÄØ Marc Riehle

HTML:
Job Description

We at sevDesk:As an intuitive cloud accounting software, we empower founders, self-employed individuals, and small business owners to focus on what truly matters. Our product offers them a smart accounting tool to save time in their daily activities. As a company, we aim for excellence, continuously expand our horizons, and strive for daily improvement of our product and our daily work life. In pursuit of these goals, we rely on our strong culture, innovative spirit, and unwavering passion. In the future, we hope to count you among our dedicated team members.

Your mission:

You are an analytical consultant for the data- and insights-driven development of our Customer Success Team. With your analysis, you identify optimization potential in the organization and influence our Customer Service and Support roadmap with your recommendations for action.

Here's how you'll make an impact:

  • You analyze user behavior data and use it to support our Customer Success Teams in optimizing customer retention and identifying the most critical customer problems.
  • You collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to analyze customer-journey touchpoints to continuously improve how our customers interact with our software.
  • You scrutinize our Service & Support activities, detect shifts in KPI performance, and, in partnership with your stakeholders, translate the findings into data-driven hypotheses and actionable recommendations.
  • You prepare your findings visually so that it is easy for your stakeholders to incorporate them into their decisions.
  • You design optimizations in data collection and continuously develop the reporting ecosystem.
  • You support your colleagues in using product data and help keep our quality standards high with peer reviews
  • Reporting and analyzing churn prevention activities, onboarding flows, and the impact of customer communications to help the teams boost engagement and retention.

Your Qualification:

  • You have at least 3 years of experience as a Data Analyst (m/f/x), preferably in a digital and/or SaaS environment.
  • You speak German (at least B2) and English (C1)
  • You have a degree in (business) informatics, economics, (business) mathematics or comparable.
  • You have experience using data to drive impact, including working with tools such as SQL, Tableau, Looker, Snowflake, Redshift, or comparable platforms.
  • You have relevant experience in the conception and evaluation of A/B tests, good knowledge of statistics is a plus.
  • You are proactive, results-oriented, and flexible in problem-solving both in your role and for the company.
  • Your profile is rounded off by strong communication, presentation, and organizational skills.
  • Despite your passion for data, you recognize that emotions are not always quantifiable, so you actively seek direct dialogue with our users to capture qualitative insights.

__

Our Techstack:

SQL | Snowflake | Snowplow | dbt | Python | Looker | Metabase | Mixpanel

Job Requirements

Your sevdesk Experience

Drive Impact: Make meaningful contributions and help move initiatives forward across teams. Your input will be valued, and your work will have a direct influence on sevdesk's success.

Empowered Ownership: take charge of your work and projects with the expectation of making decisions independently, supported by a team that's there when you need guidance.

Competitive Compensation: Includes a stock option plan and company pension to reward your contributions.

Time to Recharge: 30 vacation days, 3 additional days for social engagement, plus 30 Workation days to work from anywhere in the EU.

Flexible Work Environment: We believe in working where you‚Äôre most productive, whether that‚Äôs at home or in the office. Our hybrid approach balances flexibility with in-person collaboration, fostering trust and strong teamwork when we come together.

Comprehensive Benefits: learning budget, bike leasing, monthly voucher of choice (Amazon, IKEA, Car Sharing, ‚Ä¶), Amazon book flat, corporate discounts and more.

Team Vibes: Enjoy regular team offsites and quarterly events packed with networking and fun!

For more insights, visit us on Instagram
