Title: Loss Control Field Inspector
Company: Brown & Joseph AR Management | an ARMStrong IS Company
Description:
ARMStrong¬†Insurance Services is the leading and most trusted name in the world of debt recovery and financial solutions. With a track record of excellence and reliability, we have proudly served businesses across various industries for decades, ensuring efficient B2B collections and tailored debt recovery solutions. As the parent company, ARMStrong is proud to own and operate Altus Receivables Management Group, Brown & Joseph, Paragon, SubroIQ, and NEIS each a powerhouse in their own right, providing specialized expertise in debt management and financial services.
¬†

NEIS is currently looking for Loss Control Field Inspectors to join our team!!! Loss Control Field Inspectors conduct insurance loss control inspections on either commercial or residential dwellings.

**This is a Part-Time/Occasional Job** Hours can vary from week to week but you make your own schedule**.

Job Responsibilities:¬†

Conduct physical inspections on either commercial or residential properties.
Apply manual rules and company standards¬†to find possible risks to reduce the chance of accidents
Prepare a schedule to maximize optimal use of time and to ensure time service is met
Correspond with insured via phone, email and text message as necessary to set up appointments
Complete a physical loss control survey to identify any current issues or hazards
After physical inspection is completed, prepare required reports to which includes multiple pictures
Communicate survey status via internal progress reports

Job Requirements:¬†

Competent use of digital camera, word processing and e-mail
Valid driver‚Äôs license and satisfactory driving record (based on NEIS guidelines)
Must live within 30-mile radius of territory
Job will be based from home with required travel to each inspection location within your assigned territory
Maintain automobile insurance while employed with bodily injury limits equal to or greater than $100,000 per person and $300,000 per accident or $300,000 combined

Compensation and Benefits:¬†

Compensation is roughly $50 and up per inspection (depends on the job and location)
On the job training
Base pay - paid weekly
Mileage Reimbursement - paid weekly
Production pay - paid weekly
We look forward to you joining the team!

Title: Head of Data
Description:
About Us

We are a high-growth US-based FinTech company that recently achieved unicorn status following on from our latest funding round. Our platform delivers advanced data intelligence to private markets, enabling general partners and investors to make faster and smarter investment decisions.




Why you should join

Strong financial backing from recent Series D funding to expand data infrastructure and analytics
Opportunity to lead data strategy during a pivotal scale-up phase
Collaborative culture focused on using data to transform private market investment workflows




Role Description

We are looking for a Head of Data to own the vision and execution of our data strategy. This is a technology-agnostic leadership role where your expertise in modern data architectures, analytics, and team leadership will have a direct impact on the business.




What you‚Äôll do

Define and execute a company-wide data strategy covering ingestion, warehousing, pipelines, analytics, and governance
Build and lead a high-performing data team including engineers, analysts, and data scientists
Collaborate with product, engineering, and leadership to embed data-driven decision making into the organization
Ensure data systems are scalable, reliable, secure, and compliant with industry regulations
Promote a metrics-driven culture with advanced analytics including predictive modeling and customer behavior analysis




What we‚Äôre looking for

8+ years of experience in data-focused roles, including building and scaling platforms in B2B or FinTech
At least 3 years in a leadership role managing data teams and delivering measurable business outcomes
Expertise with the modern data stack including cloud data warehouses, ETL/ELT tools, BI platforms, and machine learning infrastructure
Ability to translate complex technical insights into business strategy and influence executive decision making
Experience with financial data or private markets is a plus




What you‚Äôll get

Competitive base salary, performance bonus, and meaningful equity
Hybrid work model based in a major US FinTech hub such as New York, San Francisco, or Chicago
Resources to build and scale a data organization capable of driving the next phase of company growth
A leadership role with significant influence over product, operations, and market positioning

Title: Data Operations Specialist
Description:
At UVeye, we're on a mission to redefine vehicle safety and reliability on a global scale. Founded in 2016, we have pioneered the world's first fully automated suite of vehicle inspection systems. At the heart of this innovation lies our advanced AI-centric technology, representing the pinnacle of computer vision, machine learning, and generative AI within the automotive sector.¬†

With over $380M in funding and strategic partnerships with industry giants such as Toyota, Amazon, General Motors, Volvo, and Hertz, our technology is utilized in manufacturing plants, dealerships, wholesale auctions, delivery fleets, security checkpoints, and more. Our growing global team of over 200 employees is committed to creating a workplace that celebrates diversity, encourages teamwork, and strives for excellence.

We seek a Data Operations Specialist responsible for testing, collecting ground-truth data, documenting, and reporting on algorithm detection rates and UVeye system performance data obtained at various customer sites, with a primary focus on UV360 technology.




A day in the life and how you‚Äôll make an impact:

Working with UV360 technology as the primary focus of daily responsibilities
Perform data annotation and tagging tasks, ensuring high accuracy and quality standards to assist in the training of our AI algorithm.
Collecting ground-truth data at different customer sites
Reporting on data insights
Providing constructive feedback when needed about the data validation process.
Per the direction of the Team Lead, pivoting tasks or shifting priorities when needed.
Collaborating with different teams globally, such as Data Tagging in Israel.

Title: Associate Consumer Insights Manager
Description:
Company Description

Cricut¬Æ makes smart cutting machines that work with an easy-to-use app, an ever-growing collection of materials, and crafting essentials to help you design and personalize almost anything ‚Äî custom cards, unique apparel, everyday items, and so much more.

We believe everyone is born creative. We‚Äôre a diverse tapestry of thinkers, dreamers, givers, DIYers, handi-workers, artisans, and forever and always architects of things.

At Cricut, we place the power of handmade into the hands of all. We give you beautiful, easy-to-master tools so you can make something unique, remarkable, perfect. We surround you with ideas, community, inspiration, and encouragement to take your creativity further than you ever imagined. And as a community, we celebrate the exhilarating act of making every single day.

So, make that handcrafted card that feels like a hug. Design a shirt for fun, for family, or for a full-blown business. Craft with a passion or for a purpose. Make something big and bold, itsy-bitsy, amazingly ambitious, or just plain silly. Whatever you make, just make your heart out. Because here‚Äôs the remarkable truth: When we all make together, we make all things possible.

Let‚Äôs make.

Job Description

We are seeking a driven and insightful Consumer Insights Manager or Associate Consumer Insights Manager to play a pivotal role in shaping our new product launches and expanding our brand within the creative project-making space. In this role, you will bring our strategic product research agenda to live, translating consumer passion and needs into innovative product concepts and enhanced consumer experiences. Partnering closely with product managers and cross-functional teams, you will design, conduct, and analyze research, transforming insights into strategies that advance our products and the consumer experience.

You will lead and execute quantitative (e.g., category trend analysis, attitude and usage studies, concept testing, syndicated data analysis) and qualitative (e.g., IDIs, panel communities, online bulletin boards, focus groups, ethnographies) research, designing the right study for the question at hand. The ideal candidate will have both client-side and vendor/supplier-side experience, with a focus on product innovation.

Responsibilities


Design and execute adhoc research projects, quant or qual, from start to finish, including refining and clarifying stakeholder research requests, designing studies, developing questionnaires or discussion guides, programming surveys or screeners, fielding surveys or recruiting for qualitative studies using internal or third-party sample, analyzing data, creating final reports, and aligning teams on recommendations
Conduct qualitative research, including IDIs, panel communities, online bulletin boards, focus groups, and ethnographies
Analyze large survey-based datasets and conduct higher-level analysis, including driver analysis
Provide design, execution, and analysis support to research projects your Consumer Insights teammates are leading
Develop expertise in our existing body of research, extracting key learnings to answer questions and ensure new studies speak to existing insights
Employ team, industry, and research-on-research best practices in your work
Ensure stakeholder buy-in, taking care that stakeholders have a stake in, digest, and know how to apply research findings
Partner with cross-functional teams, using insights to drive alignment, action, and win-win outcomes
This is a hands-on role, with potential to manage vendors


Qualifications


5+ years of consumer insights experience in a corporate environment, on the research supplier side as well as client side
Deep experience designing and executing quantitative or qualitative research studies from start to finish
Experience analyzing large survey-based datasets and conducting analysis using SPSS
Skilled at insight generation and synthesis across studies
Knowledge of and adherence to research best practices
Detail-oriented; ensures reporting is accurate and put into appropriate context
Strong project management skills; ability to juggle multiple projects at one time and self-prioritize workload
Excellent communicator and cross-functional relationship builder
Team player who prioritizes team and business needs
Exceptional self-management skills and high EQ
Entrepreneurial spirit, with passion for process improvement
Experience managing vendors a plus
Bachelor‚Äôs degree, preferably in the social sciences; advanced degree is a plus


Additional Information

Compensation Range: $80k-$138k

A Quick Note Before You Apply‚Ä¶

Cricut is in a powerful chapter of transformation. We‚Äôre evolving fast‚Äîrefining our strategy, growing our teams, and raising the bar across the board. This is an incredible opportunity for the right kind of person‚Äîbut it‚Äôs not for everyone.

We‚Äôre looking for A-players‚Äîpeople who don‚Äôt just meet expectations, but consistently exceed them. If you thrive in dynamic environments and find joy in turning challenges into momentum, keep reading.

Here‚Äôs what makes someone a great fit for this role (and for this moment at Cricut):

You have a bias for urgency.

You don‚Äôt wait for perfect clarity to take action‚Äîyou start, learn, and adjust. You believe that speed matters, especially when paired with thoughtfulness. You ask: ‚ÄúWhat can move forward today?‚Äù and push past inertia.

You set high standards‚Äîespecially for yourself.

You‚Äôre proud of your work and protective of your reputation. You take ownership, deliver quality, and don‚Äôt cut corners. You hold yourself accountable without waiting to be asked.

You stay focused when things are moving fast.

You can identify what really matters and don‚Äôt get distracted by noise. You prioritize well, and manage your time wisely.

You collaborate like a pro.

You elevate the people around you, communicate clearly, and give thoughtful feedback. You‚Äôre low ego, high output‚Äîand your team loves working with you.

What To Do Next

Please attach your resume including links to your portfolio where applicable. If you want to show your super powers in other ways ‚Äì include that information too. You can be sure that Cricut¬Æ is an employer who values individuality, equality and diversity, so tell us what you‚Äôre all about. If you are a Maker or a DIY enthusiast, whether you think you are a good one or not, we would love to hear about it when you send us your information!

At Cricut¬Æ, we celebrate inclusion and diversity. Cricut is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions based on merit. Cricut prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual identity, gender identity, marital status, veteran status, nationality, citizenship, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or any other unlawful consideration. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Cricut participates in E-Verify.

Title: Solutions Consultant, File Integrations
Description:
About Lyra Health

Lyra is transforming mental health care through technology with a human touch to help people feel emotionally healthy at work and at home. We work with industry leaders, such as Morgan Stanley, Uber, Amgen, and other Fortune 500 companies, to improve access to effective, high-quality mental health care for their employees and their families. With our innovative digital care platform and global provider network, nearly 20 million people can receive the best care and feel better, faster. Founded by David Ebersman, former CFO of Facebook and Genentech, Lyra has raised more than $900 million.

About The Role

Lyra Health is looking for a Solutions Consultant I, File Integrations. Looking for an experienced professional with advanced technical expertise in file integration solutions. Looking for someone who is excited to make a significant impact within a dynamic and innovative organization.

This role can be carried out from our Burlingame, CA headquarters, hybrid, or fully remote/virtually. Remote candidates must be physically located within the United States.

Responsibilities


Provide guidance and solutions to customers and internal teams regarding file integration technologies, leveraging technical expertise
Serve as a point of contact for customers and internal teams, building strong relationships to understand their business needs and objectives related to File Integrations
Support project management and implementation of file integrations for new and existing customers, collaborating extensively with internal and external stakeholders including Customer Success, Data Science, DevOps, Business Operations, Billing Operations, and Legal
Troubleshoot and resolve any file integration issues that arise during implementation or post-implementation, utilizing problem-solving skills and technical expertise
Work with cross-functional teams to share knowledge and expertise, fostering a culture of learning and collaboration


Qualifications


3+ years experience in a customer-facing role, in Implementation, Customer Success, Support or Sales
Demonstrated commitment to continuous learning and professional development
Highly self-motivated, action-oriented and willing to collaborate cross functionally in a fast-paced and fast-growing environment
Strong attention to detail, and an ability to thrive in ambiguity
Proven presentation skills with strong professional presence
Articulate and persuasive communication skills, both written and verbal
Passion for mental health and changing the healthcare landscape


"We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, age, disability, genetic information or any other category protected by law.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge that your personal information will be processed as per the Lyra Health Workforce Privacy Notice. Through this application, to the extent permitted by law, we will collect personal information from you including, but not limited to, your name, email address, gender identity, employment information, and phone number for the purposes of recruiting and assessing suitability, aptitude, skills, qualifications, and interests for employment with Lyra. We may also collect information about your race, ethnicity, and sexual orientation, which is considered sensitive personal information under the California Privacy Rights Act (CPRA) and special category data under the UK and EU GDPR. Providing this information is optional and completely voluntary, and if you provide it you consent to Lyra processing it for the purposes as described at the point of collection, for example for diversity and inclusion initiatives. If you are a California resident and would like to limit how we use this information, please use the Limit the Use of My Sensitive Personal Information form. This information will only be retained for as long as needed to fulfill the purposes for which it was collected, as described above. Please note that Lyra does not ‚Äúsell‚Äù or ‚Äúshare‚Äù personal information as defined by the CPRA. Outside of the United States, for example in the EU, Switzerland and the UK, you may have the right to request access to, or a copy of, your personal information, including in a portable format; request that we delete your information from our systems; object to or restrict processing of your information; or correct inaccurate or outdated personal information in our systems. These rights may be subject to legal limitations. To exercise your data privacy rights outside of the United States, please contact globaldpo@lyrahealth.com. For more information about how we use and retain your information, please see our Workforce Privacy Notice."

As a full-time Solutions Consultant, File Integrations, you will be employed by Lyra Health, Inc. The anticipated annual base salary range for this full-time position is $85,000 to $130,000. The base range is determined by role and level, and placement within the range will depend on a number of job-related factors, including but not limited to your skills, qualifications, experience and location. This role may also be eligible for discretionary bonuses.

Benefits

Annual salary is only one part of an employee‚Äôs total compensation package at Lyra. We also offer generous benefits that include:


Comprehensive healthcare coverage (including medical, dental, vision, FSA/HSA, life and disability insurances)
Lyra for Lyrians; coaching and therapy services
Equity in the company through discretionary restricted stock units
Competitive time off with pay policies including vacation, sick days, and company holidays
Paid parental leave
401K retirement benefits
Monthly tech allowance
We like to spread joy throughout the year with well-being perks and activities, surprise swag, free food, regular community celebration‚Ä¶and more!


We can‚Äôt wait to meet you.

HTML:
About Lyra Health

Lyra is transforming mental health care through technology with a human touch to help people feel emotionally healthy at work and at home. We work with industry leaders, such as Morgan Stanley, Uber, Amgen, and other Fortune 500 companies, to improve access to effective, high-quality mental health care for their employees and their families. With our innovative digital care platform and global provider network, nearly 20 million people can receive the best care and feel better, faster. Founded by David Ebersman, former CFO of Facebook and Genentech, Lyra has raised more than $900 million.

About The Role

Lyra Health is looking for a Solutions Consultant I, File Integrations. Looking for an experienced professional with advanced technical expertise in file integration solutions. Looking for someone who is excited to make a significant impact within a dynamic and innovative organization.

This role can be carried out from our Burlingame, CA headquarters, hybrid, or fully remote/virtually. Remote candidates must be physically located within the United States.

Responsibilities

  • Provide guidance and solutions to customers and internal teams regarding file integration technologies, leveraging technical expertise
  • Serve as a point of contact for customers and internal teams, building strong relationships to understand their business needs and objectives related to File Integrations
  • Support project management and implementation of file integrations for new and existing customers, collaborating extensively with internal and external stakeholders including Customer Success, Data Science, DevOps, Business Operations, Billing Operations, and Legal
  • Troubleshoot and resolve any file integration issues that arise during implementation or post-implementation, utilizing problem-solving skills and technical expertise
  • Work with cross-functional teams to share knowledge and expertise, fostering a culture of learning and collaboration

Qualifications

  • 3+ years experience in a customer-facing role, in Implementation, Customer Success, Support or Sales
  • Demonstrated commitment to continuous learning and professional development
  • Highly self-motivated, action-oriented and willing to collaborate cross functionally in a fast-paced and fast-growing environment
  • Strong attention to detail, and an ability to thrive in ambiguity
  • Proven presentation skills with strong professional presence
  • Articulate and persuasive communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Passion for mental health and changing the healthcare landscape

"We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, age, disability, genetic information or any other category protected by law.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge that your personal information will be processed as per the Lyra Health Workforce Privacy Notice. Through this application, to the extent permitted by law, we will collect personal information from you including, but not limited to, your name, email address, gender identity, employment information, and phone number for the purposes of recruiting and assessing suitability, aptitude, skills, qualifications, and interests for employment with Lyra. We may also collect information about your race, ethnicity, and sexual orientation, which is considered sensitive personal information under the California Privacy Rights Act (CPRA) and special category data under the UK and EU GDPR. Providing this information is optional and completely voluntary, and if you provide it you consent to Lyra processing it for the purposes as described at the point of collection, for example for diversity and inclusion initiatives. If you are a California resident and would like to limit how we use this information, please use the Limit the Use of My Sensitive Personal Information form. This information will only be retained for as long as needed to fulfill the purposes for which it was collected, as described above. Please note that Lyra does not ‚Äúsell‚Äù or ‚Äúshare‚Äù personal information as defined by the CPRA. Outside of the United States, for example in the EU, Switzerland and the UK, you may have the right to request access to, or a copy of, your personal information, including in a portable format; request that we delete your information from our systems; object to or restrict processing of your information; or correct inaccurate or outdated personal information in our systems. These rights may be subject to legal limitations. To exercise your data privacy rights outside of the United States, please contact globaldpo@lyrahealth.com. For more information about how we use and retain your information, please see our Workforce Privacy Notice."

As a full-time Solutions Consultant, File Integrations, you will be employed by Lyra Health, Inc. The anticipated annual base salary range for this full-time position is $85,000 to $130,000. Benefits

Annual salary is only one part of an employee‚Äôs total compensation package at Lyra. We also offer generous benefits that include:

  • Comprehensive healthcare coverage (including medical, dental, vision, FSA/HSA, life and disability insurances)

Title: Graduate 2025 Software Engineer I, US
Description:
About The Role

At Uber, engineers address a wide variety of bold problems and situations as we continue to innovate and develop products. We expect our engineers to be proficient in data structures, algorithms, and problem-solving - this includes being a specialist in the programming language of your choice.

We believe effective communication is an attribute in any successful engineer, as you and your team move in the fast-paced development environment. Uber engineers regularly collaborate with teammates to build and maintain services and solutions to support user-facing products, downstream services, and infrastructure tools and platforms used globally.

We build the platforms, products, tools, and processes so that our developers across Uber can provide an outstanding experience to our end customers. Join us as we reimagine the way the world moves.

These roles may be based out of any of the following locations: San Francisco, California

Basic Qualifications


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field, or equivalent experience in an engineering related bootcamp
Must have graduated or completed an engineering related bootcamp between January 2024 to October 2025
Proficient experience with one or more of the following programming languages: Java, Go, C/C++, Python, Ruby, etc.
If selected, must be willing to start the role no later than October 22nd, 2025


Preferred Qualifications


Detailed problem-solving approach and knowledge of algorithms, data structures, and complexity analysis
Desire to work with a team that delivers impactful results every day
Passion for building distributed systems at hyper-scale
Grit, drive, and a strong sense of ownership coupled with an appetite for collaboration
Dedication to writing understandable, maintainable, and reusable software


About Uber

At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world!

We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have a curiosity, passion and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let's move the world forward, together!

Uber is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form .

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Status: 6 month Fixed Term Contract

Reports to: Global Payroll Manager

Works with: Finance Team

Job Purpose

Finance team: The role is to support the payroll team in managing and improving data quality, reconciliation and reporting during a period of high operational demand. The role is essential for ensuring accurate payroll reporting, supporting the rollout of a Global Payroll Provider and preparing for upcoming compliance requirements.




Principal accountabilities

Data Cleansing & Validation

Clean, structure, and validate large payroll data to ensure accuracy and consistency (both for current operations and during the roll out of the Global Payroll provider).
Identify and correct anomalies in payroll and accounting data
Collaborate with Payroll, HR and Finance teams to ensure data alignment, particularly within the HiBob platform.

Reconciliations

Perform regular reconciliations between payroll records and general ledger accounts.
Investigate and resolve discrepancies in payroll transactions and accounting entries.

Budget & Variance Analysis, Reporting

Assist in preparing payroll-related budget forecasts.
Analyse actual payroll costs against budgeted figures and explain variances.
Provide monthly variance reports with actionable insights.
Maintain year-to-date payroll reports and audit packs.
Support audits and compliance checks with accurate data and documentation.
Respond to ad hoc data requests from senior management and external auditors.
Assist in preparing data and reports for the mandatory payrolling of Benefits in Kind (BiKs) starting April 2026.
Process optimisation - Identify inefficiencies in workflows and streamline payroll processes

UAT Testing ‚Äì Global Payroll Project

Lead testing and reconciliation during parallel runs for the Global Payroll Provider rollout.

Skills And Attributes

Proven experience in data analysis within payroll or finance.
Strong Excel and data manipulation skills; experience with HiBob is a plus.
Familiarity with payroll systems, accounting principles, and compliance requirements.
Analytical mindset with attention to detail.
Ability to work collaboratively across departments.
Experience supporting audits and compliance processes is desirable.
Strong communication and documentation skills.




Essential

Qualifications and experience

Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including advanced functions (e.g. pivot tables, lookups, data validation).
Experience working with large datasets and performing data cleansing, transformation and validation.
Solid understanding of payroll processes, accounting principles, and financial reconciliations.
Familiarity with HRIS and payroll systems (e.g. HiBob, Moorepay, Papaya, Justworks or similar platforms).
Demonstrated ability to produce clear, accurate and insightful reports for stakeholders.
Experience supporting audits and compliance reporting.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with high attention to detail.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate across departments.
Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.




Preferred

Experience working within a global or multi-country payroll environment.
Experience participating in system implementations or UAT testing phases.
Ability to document processes and create user-friendly guides




Application Closing Date: 22nd August 2025

Please note that while we have a closing date for this application, we reserve the right to interview candidates and potentially close the role early should we find a suitable candidate before the closing date.




Help shape the future of reporting for global financial markets

The IFRS Foundation is a public interest, not-for profit organisation that sets corporate reporting standards for the capital markets globally. IFRS Accounting Standards are required for use by more than 140 countries whilst IFRS Sustainability Disclosure Standards are rapidly becoming the global baseline for sustainability disclosures worldwide.

We are a highly diverse and inclusive organisation. Our 350+ staff come from more than 45+ different countries and are united in supporting the mission of the Foundation to bring transparency, accountability and efficiency to capital markets worldwide. With offices in London, Frankfurt, Montreal, Tokyo, Beijing and San Francisco, the Foundation is truly a global standard-setter.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for a new challenge?

Fancy helping us shape the future of motor insurance?

Prima could be the place for you.

Since 2015, we‚Äôve been using our love of data and tech to rethink motor insurance and bring drivers a great experience at a great price. Our story began in Italy, where we‚Äôve quickly become the number one online motor insurance provider. In fact, we‚Äôre trusted by over 4 million drivers. And now we‚Äôre expanding to help millions more drivers in the UK and Spain.

To help fuel that growth, we need a Data Analyst to join our Online Sales Team.

This team serves both our business and our customers.

As part of this team, you‚Äôll optimise our online products, making sure they meet user needs and convert. You‚Äôll also help strengthen our relationship with third party partners, such as price comparison websites, so we can better connect with our audience and turn more clicks into sales.

Excited to make an impact? Here are the details

What You'll Do


Analyse data from various business areas, including online conversion, operational efficiency, trading reports and strategic projects.
Identify improvement opportunities and support data-driven decision making in collaboration with teams like Pricing, Underwriting, Product & Engineering, UX, Customer Care and Claims.
Design and maintain dashboards in Tableau to monitor performance of the metrics that matter, as well as impact of initiatives to enable deeper analysis.
Participate in the integration and automation of data exchange between local and global teams.
Collaborate with other Data Analysts and Data Scientists to share best practices and strengthen Prima‚Äôs data-driven culture.
Support and lead key business initiatives, including the launch of new channels and propositions.
Manage successful relationships with 3rd party commercial partners.


What We're Looking For


A minimum of 2‚Äì3 years of professional experience is required in data analytics, management consulting, or other roles that are analytically driven.
A Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative or analytical field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Business Administration, or Economics.
A solid understanding of business in regulated industries
Excellent analytical mindset and problem solving skills
A keenness and confidence in stakeholder management, both internally and externally.


Nice to Have


Proficiency with SQL, Python, Excel & Tableau
Experience with cloud data platforms (e.g., Databricks)
Understanding of or interest in UK Motor Insurance


Why You‚Äôll Love It Here

We want to make Prima a happy and empowering place to work. So if you decide to join us, you can expect plenty of perks.

ü§∏Work Your Way: Enjoy hybrid working, with a mix of home and office days. Plus, for up to 30 days per year, work from anywhere.

üèÅ Grow with us: We may move fast at Prima, but we move together. Get access to learning resources, mentorship and a growth plan tailored to you.

üåà Thrive and perform: Your best work begins when you feel your best. Enjoy private healthcare, gym discounts, wellbeing programs and mental health support.

Think you‚Äôre a match? Apply now.

At Prima, we celebrate uniqueness. If you don‚Äôt meet every requirement but are passionate about this role, we still want to hear from you. Innovation thrives on diverse perspectives.
Prima is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Need accommodations during the process? Email us at talent.acquisition@prima.it. Let‚Äôs build the future of insurance, together.

Title: Data Analyst - Excel, Power BI
Description:
Data Analyst - Excel, Power BI

Data Analyst - Excel, Power BI




The location of the role is Paddington, London (hybrid working).

The duration of the contract is 8 months.

The pay rate on offer is ¬£300 - ¬£350 per day (via Umbrella agency).




The client is a multinational high-street retailer.

Business area: Food Packaging




Key accountabilities and measures

Provide analytical support and reports based on data research and analysis to the Compliance Team to drive data consistency and accuracy
Resolve commercial and technical queries for all stakeholders and provide appropriate commentary to ensure clarity on root cause and avoid any reoccurrence
Deliver efficient analytical reports and insights through data research and analysis to support the Compliance Team in driving data submissions accuracy
Effective co-ordination of data gathering processes to ensure alignment with external and internal reporting requirements
Collate and maintain data reports within agreed standards
Liaise internally and externally with departments, suppliers, and compliance agencies
Ensure timely transfer of raw sales data and packaging information from different business areas
Assist compliance team with data verification for reporting and ensuring data declarations completed and submitted to schedule
Monitor and audit data quality and report any issues to key stakeholders
Identify problems and recommend solutions to improve the processes and ways or working.
Ongoing training to confidently work with the business‚Äô systems GMOR, SAP, PLM, FIND, Business objects, etc.
Resolve administrative problems and inquiries with reporting from the compliance agencies
Prepare written responses to routine enquiries
Raise any system issue logs with Tech support and ensure resolution the completion
Raise Purchase Orders and maintain the Compliance Invoicing tracker for the function.




Key skills and experience

Excellent knowledge and practical skills of Excel (PivotTables, VLOOKUP) and other Microsoft Office programs - Power BI
Ability to simultaneously manage, prioritise and deliver multiple projects/priorities on time
Strong delivery focus with great attention to detail, routine process, and completion of tasks.
Commitment to continuous improvement of digital and data skills
Confident and professional verbal and written communication skills
Takes initiative and comfortable working autonomously
Ability to initiate and build strong relationships with own team, across functions and channels

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Bionic:
Bionic is a tech-enabled business switching service. We empower small business owners with a radically better way for them to sort their business essentials through smart technology.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ¬†¬†

We're currently looking for a Data Analyst to join us in a fast-paced environment where innovative ideas and projects come to life.¬†¬†

About the Role:


Do you take satisfaction in seeing your recommendations implemented in the real world? Are you analytically creative and motivated by new challenges? Do you have a passion for working with data to drive insight and improve customer understanding?¬†

At Bionic, data is core to our business and strategy, and this role is part of a team that is critical to delivering on this goal.¬†¬†¬†

This role will build on the firm data and reporting architecture to bring insight, clarity and simplicity to what can be a complex business, ultimately making things simple for our customers.¬† As such you will leverage best in class analytics and data tools.¬†

You will have access to a wealth of data from a multitude of sources and will be translating analysis into commercially actionable insight and recommendations in a fast-paced environment.¬† The role will involve working on best practice statistical and analytical techniques to not only discover but also to test and measure impact of key strategic initiatives.¬†

You will be an important member of the Analytics team, with opportunities to interact cross functionally with Marketing, IT, Digital, Product, Commercial and Finance teams.¬†

Ultimately, this would be a great role for a Junior Analyst who is looking to take the next step to developing their skills in a fast growing Tech company.¬†



Day-to-Day:


Be a key member a small team of technical analysts, responsible for delivering business critical analysis and insight¬†
Be hands on in the coding of Bionic data to deliver analytical solutions to business problems and opportunities¬†
Be creative in supporting the development of analytical solutions to drive proven business value¬†
Able to work in a fast-paced environment, having the confidence to voice your thoughts and opinions¬†¬†
Implementing rigorous testing and measurement: working on testing and measurement across products and functions, implementing methodologies to serve highly iterative and fast paced roadmap.¬†

HTML:
About Bionic:
Bionic is a tech-enabled business switching service. We empower small business owners with a radically better way for them to sort their business essentials through smart technology.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ  

We're currently looking for a Data Analyst to join us in a fast-paced environment where innovative ideas and projects come to life.  

About the Role:

Do you take satisfaction in seeing your recommendations implemented in the real world? Are you analytically creative and motivated by new challenges? Do you have a passion for working with data to drive insight and improve customer understanding? 

At Bionic, data is core to our business and strategy, and this role is part of a team that is critical to delivering on this goal.   

This role will build on the firm data and reporting architecture to bring insight, clarity and simplicity to what can be a complex business, ultimately making things simple for our customers.  As such you will leverage best in class analytics and data tools. 

You will have access to a wealth of data from a multitude of sources and will be translating analysis into commercially actionable insight and recommendations in a fast-paced environment.  The role will involve working on best practice statistical and analytical techniques to not only discover but also to test and measure impact of key strategic initiatives. 

You will be an important member of the Analytics team, with opportunities to interact cross functionally with Marketing, IT, Digital, Product, Commercial and Finance teams. 

Ultimately, this would be a great role for a Junior Analyst who is looking to take the next step to developing their skills in a fast growing Tech company. 

Day-to-Day:

  • Be a key member a small team of technical analysts, responsible for delivering business critical analysis and insight 
  • Be hands on in the coding of Bionic data to deliver analytical solutions to business problems and opportunities 
  • Be creative in supporting the development of analytical solutions to drive proven business value 
  • Able to work in a fast-paced environment, having the confidence to voice your thoughts and opinions  
  • Implementing rigorous testing and measurement: working on testing and measurement across products and functions, implementing methodologies to serve highly iterative and fast paced roadmap. 
  • Communicate analysis to drive engagement: Share analytical results in a commercial and compelling manner, with ability to visualise insights in a clear and concise format 
  • Keep up to date with new and emerging technologies: best in class techniques and application to real business problems 
  • Learn and help share knowledge to grow capability of the team and Bionic: ensure that learnings are shared within the team and the business to drive a data driven culture.  Actively participate in trainings, documentation of learnings and data/analytics sharing sessions

Essential Skills and Experience:

  • Confident User of SQL and Python 
  • Experience analysing large and complex datasets - Cloud-based data platforms preferred 
  • Understanding of statistical and data science techniques (e.g. forecasting, regression, clustering etc) to deliver business projects 
  • Experience in Data Visualisation (Tableau (preferred), Power BI, Looker) 
  • Degree level or higher in a numerate subject (e.g. Maths, Statistics, Economics, Operational Research or Computer Science) 
  • 1-2 years' experience in a data analyst or similar role, preferably in a fast-paced commercial or digital environment. 

Who We're Looking For:

  • A commercially driven analyst for a Data and Analytics team passionate about driving business growth  
  • Ability to demonstrate an analytical ‚Äòcuriosity' through innovative, data driven insights about business questions 
  • Ability to explore business impact and position analysis to deliver commercial value 
  • A self-starter that is curious and keen to learn new approaches and techniques as well as demonstrate innovation in approach  
  • A keen sharer of information with the ability to translate analysis into insight and support delivery of compelling commercial recommendations 
  • Curious, proactive, ambitious, storyteller, loves solving complex problems and excited to help others and share the success, team player 
  • Experience working in cross-functional teams (with product, commercial, marketing and IT) is preferrable  
  • It would be highly desirable if you had experience within one of the following: Digital, B2B, Retail and Customer Data


Interview process 

  • Initial conversation with one of our Talent Acquisition Team 
  • 1st stage Teams interview with the hiring manager and a colleague from the Data Analytics team 
  • 2nd stage in-person case study-based interview 

About the Bionic Group 

Bionic has over 600 colleagues working across three office locations and four businesses; Bionic - London (HQ), Bionic Outbound - Luton, Think Business Loans - Chelmsford, and Smart -our Field based agents. 

Working at Bionic means provides you many opportunities to advance your career, with incredible progression, recognition, and reward. 

Benefits  

Enhance your health & wellbeing üå± 

  • Private healthcare cover 
  • Employee Assistance Programme, including a virtual GP service, priority physio & talking therapies 
  • Eyecare scheme 

Taking time away from work üèñÔ∏è 

  • 25 days annual leave plus the 8 UK bank holidays, increasing with tenure 
  • 1 paid family/religious day of leave per year - following successful probation period 
  • 1 paid charity volunteering day per year 
  • Option to buy/sell up to an additional 3 days leave per year 

Family matters: for the special moments üè† 

  • Enhanced maternity, paternity or shared parental leave 
  • 2 days off for your wedding upon joining, and up to 5 days after 2 years' service 
  • Flexible working options & a hybrid work approach 

Financial wellbeing üí∏ 

  • Auto-enrolled salary sacrifice pension scheme  
  • Life assurance 
  • Season ticket Loans, salary advances & loans to buy/rent a home - based on tenure 
  • Cycle to work scheme 

Recognition üåü 

  • Highflyers incentive, a VIP experience for our high performers across Bionic group to celebrate success 
  • Company summer & Christmas party celebrations, business and local zonely & annual awards and recognition  
  • Long service awards

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Junior Data Analyst (Power BI / SQL)

Location: London (Hybrid ‚Äì 2 days onsite)

Salary: ¬£45,000 + Benefits

Job Type: Full-Time, Permanent




Are you a data-driven thinker using Power BI and SQL?

Looking for a collaborative environment where you can make a real impact while continuing to grow your skills?




We‚Äôre hiring a Data Analyst to join a growing team within a dynamic and forward-thinking Insurance services company with a global footprint. Reporting directly to the Group Data Lead, you‚Äôll play a hands-on role in developing high-quality dashboards, reporting tools, and data solutions used by internal stakeholders and external clients.




What You‚Äôll Be Doing:

Build and maintain Power BI dashboards, including externally-facing reports for clients and underwriting teams
Write SQL queries to extract, transform and support backend reporting
Collaborate with internal teams to gather requirements and translate them into insightful visualisations
Develop KPI dashboards and static reports (Excel, PowerPoint) for strategic insights
Support client rollouts and help onboard data-driven solutions




Tech Stack & Tools:

Power BI (including Paginated Reports)
SQL
Excel & PowerPoint
Familiarity with Microsoft Fabric is a bonus




Ideal Candidate:

1 years of experience in a Data Analyst or Reporting Analyst role
Solid experience with Power BI and confident using SQL
Strong communication skills ‚Äì able to work with both technical and non-technical teams
A proactive, delivery-focused mindset ‚Äì someone who takes ownership of tasks
Keen to learn and develop in a non-hierarchical, supportive environment
Comfortable working with small to mid-sized datasets (this is not a big data role)




What‚Äôs on Offer:

Competitive salary (up to ¬£45K)
Hybrid working ‚Äì 2 days per week in a central London office
A supportive team with mentorship from senior data professionals
Exposure to global teams across Europe, the US, and Asia
An inclusive, values-led culture with strong ethical foundations




If you're excited about leveraging your Power BI and SQL skills in a meaningful way and want to be part of a forward-thinking, global environment ‚Äî apply today!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Data Migration to Workday HCM / Freelance (Inside IR35)




You‚Äôll be working closely with our colleagues across the ERP Transformation Team alongside our Finance, IT, Data & Tech teams and other broader functions to support our global employee data collection, reporting and updating. We are undergoing a large transformation across our People function and the ERP Transformation team has a vast array of projects with touchpoints across multiple projects. We need a data analyst to help us deliver accurate and timely global employee data reports whenever and however needed.




We are building a holistic, sustainable and scalable People Operating Model enabled by Workday HCM and other technology solutions, alongside new ways of working in our service delivery model, including payroll harmonization.




What you'll do




Reporting into the People Transformation Data Lead, you will:




¬∑ Become the company's subject matter expert in all things related to global employee data with curiosity and a willingness to dive into the details to understand the data, it sources and definitions.

¬∑ Filter and ‚Äúclean‚Äù data by reviewing validation reports.

¬∑ Update data within various source systems, which will require an understanding of our data lineage.

¬∑ Identify opportunities to establish and/or improve operational processes to update and maintain our data, improving quality and implementing scalable solutions for our employee data lifecycle.

¬∑ Document end to end data entry, update, and reporting processes.

¬∑ Assist with communications notifying stakeholders of new/improved processes.

¬∑ Responsible for stakeholder issue resolution.

¬∑ Assist with future upgrades and system enhancements which may include new software.

¬∑ Interpret stakeholder data reporting requirements, analyse data and provide outgoing reports.

¬∑ Scope out and support projects related to our data that span functions.

¬∑ Implement metrics and timelines with any data project required.

¬∑ Manage multiple data-related projects at one time, identifying and raising risks, dependencies, and prioritization concerns.




What you'll need:




¬∑ Analytical, quantitative, and problem-solving skills

¬∑ HCM / People Data Experience; Workday HCM a plus

¬∑ Workday Enterprise Interface Builder experience

¬∑ Experience of Data visualization tools

¬∑ Willingness to learn new tools and systems

¬∑ Ability to effectively communicate across a global community which requires an openness to diversity of thought, backgrounds and cultures

¬∑ Technology experience or interest

¬∑ Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal skills

¬∑ Comfortable in dealing with all levels of company leadership

¬∑ Team player but also able to determine workload and be self-motivated

¬∑ General enthusiasm for growth and a willingness to be hands on




Start date: 4th August

Duration: 12 month contract

Location: London (some days on-site required)

Rate: ¬£550-575 per day ** INSIDE IR35 **

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Junior Data Analyst

Location: London, UK (Hybrid)

Salary: ¬£35k‚Äì¬£40k (DOE)




Are you a detail-driven analyst with a passion for data and automation? Join a specialist investment firm that partners with some of the most exciting high-growth software companies across Europe and the US. In this dynamic role, you‚Äôll play a critical part in streamlining data-driven workflows and powering smarter investment decisions through innovative tech.




This is an exciting opportunity for an early-career analyst to join a growing Data & Research function that sits at the heart of the firm‚Äôs investment strategy. You'll be part of a high-impact team driving digital transformation and working with modern tools to improve processes, insights, and decision-making.




Your Responsibilities:

Build and enhance data pipelines: Help design and maintain proprietary automation systems that support investment strategy.
Improve internal platforms: Collaborate on projects to streamline workflows and eliminate manual processes using modern tooling.
Deliver high-quality insights: Monitor key data metrics and trends to support investment research and decision-making.
Ensure data integrity: Validate and enrich datasets to maintain accuracy, completeness, and consistency across internal platforms.
Evaluate tools and vendors: Assist in reviewing and optimising external data providers and technical solutions.
Contribute to innovation: Continuously explore opportunities to improve systems through experimentation, automation, and modern engineering practices.




Requirements:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a STEM or data-oriented field such as Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or Economics.
A meticulous attention to detail and passion for accurate, high-quality data.
Interest in data automation and how technology enables smarter decision-making.
Exposure to or willingness to learn tools like Python, SQL, Zapier, n8n, or similar.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while delivering at pace.
Strong communication skills to collaborate across teams and share insights clearly with non-technical stakeholders.
A curiosity-driven mindset and eagerness to learn new technologies and data tools.




It's A Bonus If You Have:

Experience with Google Cloud Platform, APIs, or GitHub.
Familiarity with structured data entry, validation processes, or workflow automation.
A genuine interest in private equity, venture capital, or financial technology.




The Benefits:

Join a mission-driven firm focused on supporting exceptional software companies.
Opportunity to work on impactful projects that shape investment outcomes.
Hybrid work model with a collaborative London-based team.
Mentorship and growth opportunities tailored to early-career talent.
Competitive salary and long-term progression within a growing data function.




If you're a motivated Junior Data Analyst eager to apply your skills in a fast-paced, tech-enabled environment, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply now and be part of a team turning data into competitive advantage.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data & Insights Analyst

Location: London (Hybrid)

Type: Full-time

Salary: ¬£55,000‚Äì¬£65,000 (DOE)




About the Company

We‚Äôre working with a London-based luxury fashion brand that‚Äôs integrating data at the core of their operations. As the business scales, they‚Äôre developing a bespoke ERP platform to drive better decision-making across production, inventory, and sales.




The Opportunity

This is a great opportunity for a skilled Data & Insights Analyst to join a growing team and help shape how data is used across the business. You‚Äôll be responsible for designing pipelines, building dashboards, and delivering insight to support product and operational excellence.




Key Responsibilities

Build and maintain ETL processes using Python and Power Query M
Create clear, insightful dashboards in Power BI using DAX
Work closely with engineering and product teams to embed analytics into the ERP platform
Analyse large datasets to support operational efficiency and continuous improvement
Contribute to forecasting and inventory optimisation initiatives
Present findings to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Help establish and maintain best practices in data governance




What We‚Äôre Looking For

A STEM degree from a Russell Group university or equivalent
At least 2 years‚Äô experience using Python for data analysis
Advanced Power BI skills, including DAX and Power Query M
Solid SQL experience and comfort working with relational databases
Strong analytical and communication skills
Experience working with product teams to implement data-driven solutions
Familiarity with forecasting or inventory planning is a plus




Why Apply?

Play a key role in shaping a data-first approach at a high-end fashion brand
Work in a hybrid environment with flexibility and autonomy
Competitive salary in a growing, innovation-focused business

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
About The Role

Purpose

Reporting to the Head of Data Insight & Analytics, this role will support with the development and progression of 7IM‚Äôs business intelligence and insight capability. Sitting within the Data & Analytics team, this role will directly support 7IM‚Äôs Transformation function through building dashboards, insight tools and supporting key stakeholders, including the Chief Transformation Officer and the Transformation Leadership Group, with data-driven decision making. The role would suit an ambitious and driven junior individual who is looking for an opportunity to advance their understanding of data, working closely with business leaders to generate meaningful insight.

Responsibilities


Over time, act as the subject matter expert (SME) for data analytics to 7IM‚Äôs Transformation function.
Work closely with senior leadership, key stakeholders & data to draw together requirements, collaborate on data requests and gather feedback for improvement to support business goals.
Draft, build, maintain and drive adoption of Power BI dashboards and other similar data products using APIs linked to key Transformation systems.
Collaborating with existing business SMEs, analyse and interpret data to support senior leadership with understanding trends, defining strategy and making business decisions.
Own the rollout, training and continuous improvement of new and existing dashboards or data products ‚Äì delivering training sessions when required.
Track and enforce robust data quality standards, collaborating with the Data Governance and Infrastructure teams where necessary.
Regularly communicate key updates on progress and future plans to stakeholders, joining relevant team meetings or producing ad-hoc email communications to support this.
Work collaboratively and effectively within in a small team to create, inform, and champion data and analytics best practices.


While not directly interacting with customers, your actions should align with upholding the FCA's Consumer Duty principles, thereby contributing to fair and beneficial outcomes for our clients

About You

Knowledge


A basic understanding of the structure and purpose of the Financial Advice and Wealth Management markets within the UK Financial Services sector.
A basic understanding of the positioning of financial advice products and the use of platforms within client propositions with some understanding of the key features and competitors in this market.
Knowledge of the Agile methodology would be beneficial.


Qualifications


No specific qualifications are required for this role; however, the successful candidate will be expected to complete the Microsoft Certified: Power BI Data Analyst Associate certification within their probation period (6 months).


Skills/Other Relevant Information


Excellent numerical skills are essential, enabling easy interpretation and analysis of large volumes of data.
Experience with Python is highly beneficial and you will be expected to be able to use Python to draw data from APIs into reports.
Experience with Power BI will be key to this role in the long term, although learning and development will be provided to support this.
Ability to analyse data ‚Äì with an eye for attention to detail - and communicate your understanding to stakeholders to support with decision making processes.
Ability to write concisely, cherry-picking key insights to deliver valuable intelligence.
Confidence to work independently and efficiently on projects with business stakeholders.
Strong written and verbal communications skills.
Confident in the use of Excel for basic data manipulation and transformation.


About Us

Not Specified

Reporting to the Head of Data Insight & Analytics, this role will support with the development and progression of 7IM‚Äôs business intelligence and insight capability. Sitting within the Data & Analytics team, this role will directly support 7IM‚Äôs Transformation function through building dashboards, insight tools and supporting key stakeholders, including the Chief Transformation Officer and the Transformation Leadership Group, with data-driven decision making. The role would suit an ambitious and driven junior individual who is looking for an opportunity to advance their understanding of data, working closely with business leaders to generate meaningful insight.

Responsibilities

  • Over time, act as the subject matter expert (SME) for data analytics to 7IM‚Äôs Transformation function.
  • Work closely with senior leadership, key stakeholders & data to draw together requirements, collaborate on data requests and gather feedback for improvement to support business goals.
  • Draft, build, maintain and drive adoption of Power BI dashboards and other similar data products using APIs linked to key Transformation systems.
  • Collaborating with existing business SMEs, analyse and interpret data to support senior leadership with understanding trends, defining strategy and making business decisions.
  • Own the rollout, training and continuous improvement of new and existing dashboards or data products ‚Äì delivering training sessions when required.
  • Track and enforce robust data quality standards, collaborating with the Data Governance and Infrastructure teams where necessary.
  • Regularly communicate key updates on progress and future plans to stakeholders, joining relevant team meetings or producing ad-hoc email communications to support this.
  • Work collaboratively and effectively within in a small team to create, inform, and champion data and analytics best practices.

While not directly interacting with customers, your actions should align with upholding the FCA's Consumer Duty principles, thereby contributing to fair and beneficial outcomes for our clients

About You

Knowledge

  • A basic understanding of the structure and purpose of the Financial Advice and Wealth Management markets within the UK Financial Services sector.
  • A basic understanding of the positioning of financial advice products and the use of platforms within client propositions with some understanding of the key features and competitors in this market.
  • Knowledge of the Agile methodology would be beneficial.

Qualifications

  • No specific qualifications are required for this role; however, the successful candidate will be expected to complete the Microsoft Certified: Power BI Data Analyst Associate certification within their probation period (6 months).

Skills/Other Relevant Information

  • Excellent numerical skills are essential, enabling easy interpretation and analysis of large volumes of data.
  • Experience with Python is highly beneficial and you will be expected to be able to use Python to draw data from APIs into reports.
  • Experience with Power BI will be key to this role in the long term, although learning and development will be provided to support this.
  • Ability to analyse data ‚Äì with an eye for attention to detail - and communicate your understanding to stakeholders to support with decision making processes.
  • Ability to write concisely, cherry-picking key insights to deliver valuable intelligence.
  • Confidence to work independently and efficiently on projects with business stakeholders.
  • Strong written and verbal communications skills.
  • Confident in the use of Excel for basic data manipulation and transformation.

About Us

Not Specified

Title: Data Analyst, EMEA Supply Chain Operations ‚Äì 1 Year Fixed Contract
Description:
Job Description

Join our dynamic team at LEGO and play a pivotal role in transforming our EMEA Supply Chain Operations through innovative data solutions and process automation that drive efficiency and visibility!


Core Responsibilities





Develop impactful reporting through effective data sourcing, transformation, and visualization to provide operational insights that drive actionable outcomes.
Implement digital process automation in line with Citizen Development guidelines, to enhance operational efficiency in Supply Chain Operations.
Ensure data quality and compliance across all reporting and optimization initiatives by applying data governance principles.
Follow established standards for robust, documented, and supportable solutions with effective change management.
Collaborate with operational teams to gather user stories, assess business goals, risks, and anticipated value.
Share processes and technical solutions to support the definition of global standards, enhancing value as One LEGO Team.
Promote digital capabilities by educating and empowering teams with digital skills.
Build understanding of Global Supply Chain processes and leverage data solutions to improve operational performance.




Play your part in our team succeeding

By joining EMEA Supply Chain Operations, you will have the opportunity to work with our talented team and play an active part in putting our products into the hands of children across EMEA.

The EMEA Supply Chain Operations Technology function is part of the EMEA Supply Chain Operations organization, and supports and optimizes our operations, providing accurate, engaging and timely information to operational teams to support delivery of our priorities.

Acting as functional experts, the team supports a range of digital solutions, from collaborative creation of user stories to development, delivery and support of data solutions.

To support our digitalization journey, the function also plays an active role in building digital awareness and capability across the EMEA Supply Chain Operations organization.

Do you have what it takes?





Advanced expertise in Microsoft Power BI (incl. DAX), with strong capabilities in complex data transformation beyond visualization.
Advanced expertise in SQL or Python.
Experience across a range of data tools and platforms (such as Databricks, Alteryx, Microsoft Power Platform, for flexible data sourcing, transformation, visualization, and automation).
Proven analytical skills with Agile problem-solving experience, exceptional attention to detail, and a proactive, driven approach.
A strong communicator,that is able to translate technical concepts for non-technical audiences.
Committed to building inclusive, collaborative team environments.
Preferred Supply Chain exposure, Databricks, Alteryx and SAP experience.




Please note that we do not offer relocation assistance for this position.

Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What‚Äôs in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances ‚Äì All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount ‚Äì We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children‚Äôs Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children‚Äôs Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO¬Æ team today.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Frive - Data Analyst

Reporting to - Senior Data and Analytics Manager

Location - Canary Wharf




About us

Frive (formerly Lions Prep) is the UK‚Äôs highest-rated ready-to-eat meal delivery subscription, delivering tens of thousands of fresh, natural, chef-prepared meals to customers‚Äô doors across the UK each week.




We are committed to our vision of creating 100% organic meals without the hefty price tag, freeing us from a food system that compromises our health for profit




We work with people from all different backgrounds and communities and recognise our own biases. We strive to create a strong sense of belonging and believe we will be better equipped to achieve our goals by building a team that approaches problems from different angles, using different perspectives and experiences to solve problems. All qualified applicants will be considered and we have no regard for age, ethnicity, ability, gender, gender expression, gender identity, nationality, race, religion, or sexual orientation the more the merrier, and together we can achieve greatness




Mission:

We help busy people enjoy natural, healthy eating with ready-to-eat meals delivered to their door, proven to support their health goals.




Vision:

To transform health by revolutionising eating habits and restoring food to its natural form.

Values:

Empowerment: We empower our people to make strong, independent decisions with confidence

Transparency: We share information openly and with intention

Open Communication: We communicate directly and honestly

High Performance: We foster an environment that attracts, retains, and rewards high performance

Agility: We encourage flexibility in our people by reducing blockers and prioritising their creativity and productivity




Your impact

You'll play a key role in building and scaling our Looker instance, ensuring teams across Frive have the tools and data they need to make informed decisions. By delivering high-quality analysis and actionable insights to teams like Marketing, Finance, and Operations, you‚Äôll help drive strategic initiatives and accelerate business growth. Your work will directly support a data-driven culture across the company.




Responsibilities:

Build and scale our Looker instance to support a self-serve analytics culture
Deliver clear, reliable dashboards and reports for Marketing, Finance, and Operations
Partner with teams to define metrics that track performance and unlock growth opportunities
Investigate trends, surface insights, and guide decisions with data-backed recommendations
Support company-wide analytical initiatives, from campaign reviews to financial forecasting
Improve data quality and structure to make analysis faster and more effective
Communicate findings in a way that's actionable‚Äîno data dumps, just answers that drive impact




About you

We‚Äôre a fast-moving, collaborative team, and things can change quickly‚Äîif that excites you, you‚Äôll feel right at home. You don‚Äôt need a specific degree or a perfect CV. We care more about your mindset, your skills, and your willingness to learn.

You write solid SQL and feel confident working with large datasets
You‚Äôve used a BI tool like Looker or Tableau to build dashboards that people actually use
You‚Äôre great at turning data into insights and helping others make informed decisions
You enjoy working with non-technical teams and explaining things clearly and simply
You‚Äôre proactive, curious, and excited to help shape how we use data across the business
Bonus: you‚Äôve worked with Looker or helped build a BI setup before
Bonus: you‚Äôve touched tools like dbt, BigQuery or Git‚Äîor you‚Äôre keen to learn them here




Staff Benefits:

Private Medical Insurance
25 days Holiday + Public
Salary Sacrifice Pension
Bonus (paid out twice a year)
50% Discount off our amazing food
Hybrid working pattern (2 days in our Canary Wharf office)
Enhanced mat/pat leave
Vitality PMI
Mintago Financial Wellbeing Platform ‚Äì includes workplace mental health support via MIND, Free Financial Service Advice and LOTS more




What's next?

If you are interested in learning more about the role and think this could be for you, then don't hesitate and apply now. We look forward to hearing from you and love hearing from people who are passionate about our purpose and vision.

The Process:

Initial conversation via Teams with our Head of Talent ‚Äì you will learn about our story so far, ambitions for the future and of course have a chance to showcase your experience and talk through your own motivations
Teams meeting with our Senior Data & Analytics Manager ‚Äì getting more under the skin of what the expectations are in the role and some competency-based interview questions
Task ‚Äì presented in person in our Canary Wharf office to our Senior Data & Analytics Manager and Head Of Product ‚Äì this will be a real insight how you‚Äôd approach some of the challenges on our roadmap, leveraging your existing experience, whilst adapting to our specific needs

  3. Task ‚Äì presented in person in our Canary Wharf office to our Senior Data & Analytics Manager and Head Of Product ‚Äì this will be a real insight how you‚Äôd approach some of the challenges on our roadmap, leveraging your existing experience, whilst adapting to our specific needs

Title: Data Analyst
Company: Halian | Managed Services, Recruitment Agency & Contract Staffing
Description:
We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst with a good understanding in data modeling / data warehouse development, and business intelligence tooling to join my clients payments team, within the fintech space. This role is pivotal in building and optimizing data systems and pipelines that support analytics, reporting.




Key Responsibilities

Develop high-quality Power BI and Tableau dashboards, supporting business teams in making data-informed decisions.
Ensure data integrity, reliability, and performance through testing, monitoring, and documentation.
Exposure to Data Modelling and Warehousing would beneficial as you will need to build data models or migrate existing ones.
Drive best practices in data governance, metadata management, and data security.
Contribute to the continuous improvement of our data platform and tooling.




Required Skills & Experience

3‚Äì5 + years of experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in a FinTech or Payments environment.
Exposure and a good understansinf in data modeling (dimensional and normalized), ETL/ELT design, and data warehousing techniques.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with scripting languages such as Python or Scala.
Demonstrated ability to create impactful dashboards using Power BI and Tableau.
Deep understanding of data pipeline orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow, dbt, Azure Data Factory).
Experience working in agile, cross-functional teams, collaborating closely with data analysts, engineers, and business stakeholders.
Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and an ability to balance short-term fixes with long-term scalable solutions.




Nice to Have

Experience with real-time or streaming data (Kafka, Kinesis).
Familiarity with financial transaction data or payment processing systems.
Exposure to data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, PCI-DSS) and data security best practices




This role offers a 2 stage interview process and is required to work on site 3 days a week in central London.




Apply now to be considered!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst, 6 months, London/Hybrid, ¬£500+/day (Outside IR35)




My client, a leader in the hospitality industry, are currently looking to bring on a Data Engineer or Data Analyst on a 6 month initial contract.




Position Overview

We are seeking a Data Engineer / Data Analyst / Analytics consultant to join the Service Desk team on a contract basis. This role will be instrumental in analysing the current IT service request landscape, developing a structured service catalogue, and implementing improvements through runbooks and automation. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills and experience with data classification, Zendesk or ServiceNow.




Key Responsibilities




Service Request Analysis & Categorisation

Discover patterns in data by analysing existing service/support requests across multiple channels and systems
Turn raw data into relevant insights by developing and implementing a comprehensive categorisation system
Extract and analyse data from Zendesk/ServiceNow and other systems to identify patterns, frequencies, and resolution times
Create compelling data visualisations and reporting using tools like Excel or Looker to highlight key metrics and trends




Service Catalogue Development

Design and implement a comprehensive IT service catalogue for the organisation
Assess and assign business criticality and priority levels to different service types
Create and maintain good documentation around our data and processes to document requirements, data models, data classifications, and solutions




Please apply for more information
