Title: Reporting Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities Assist in the refinement of reporting requirements
Develop, test, and implement reports and supplemental processes to support reports for Consumer Risk Management and North American Collections, utilizing the Microsoft stack of tools (MS SQL Server, MS Reporting Services, MS Excel)
Modify/Enhance existing reports
Lead reporting projects as needed
Source required information and assist in the development of processes to retrieve data from external sources
Create Ad Hoc reports as needed
Participate in departmental Round-Table discussions to inform group of changes/enhancements to business processes that they may not be aware of
Participate/Assist in departmental cross-training program to disseminate knowledge/expertise across department personnel
Perform reporting maintenance tasks as required by department manager
Experience (Years): 4-6
Essential Skills: The Reporting Analyst role is a full time, permanent role located in Wes Allis, Wisconsin.
Responsible for development, production, documentation, and support of accurate and meaningful daily, weekly, monthly and ad hoc reports for various internal and external stakeholder groups.
The primary internal stakeholders are Consumer Risk Management and North American Collections. The mandate also requires performing investigations or analysis to identify or resolve identified issues.
The role requires a self-starter who will reach out stakeholders, to review existing processes, offering suggestions for improvement in automation or system enhancements and/or performance measures etc.
Solutions may involve creating new reports, data sets, dashboards, assisting in the automation of manual processes, or building tools to aid business users.
This position is responsible for assisting in the determination of report requirements, gathering data from various sources, transforming the data into useful information by creating meaningful reports and dashboards, and completing documentation to support the report and supplemental processes.

Title: Reference Data / UAT Analyst
Description:
Why join the CanDeal Team?

CanDeal Group is a leading provider of electronic marketplaces and data services for Canadian dollar fixed income securities and derivatives. CanDeal‚Äôs Markets Division, provides access to a deep pool of liquidity for Canadian government, agency, provincial and corporate bonds, as well as money market instruments and interest rate swaps. CanDeal Data & Analytics (DNA) delivers data and analytics products and other services that support business, trading and technology needs for participants in the Canadian capital markets.




CanDeal Group is a growing and entrepreneurial organization with a solid foundation in the Canadian fixed income markets and an ownership group which includes: BMO Nesbitt Burns Inc., CIBC World Markets Inc., National Bank Financial Inc., RBC Dominion Securities Inc., Scotia Capital Inc., TD Securities Inc. and TMX Group.




This is an exciting time to join a growing organization led by visionary leaders who are helping to shape their industry‚Äôs future.




Job Purpose




The successful candidate will form a key part of the Reference Data team responsible for maintaining the smooth running of the day-to-day operations of bonds product and services as well as supporting the questions and requests of our internal and external clients. Their primary responsibilities are to ensure the accuracy of reference data of fixed income securities added to CanDeal‚Äôs trading applications (includes cross-checking accuracy of calculations).




Will work closely with other functions within the wider team ‚Äì product management, business analysis, technology, and UAT testing.




Primary Duties




The candidate will perform a wide range of duties including but not limited to the following:

Researching and updating of newly issued deals into the database on a real time basis.
Operational maintenance of reference data for the trading and pricing products.
Cross-check fixed income calculations for accuracy. Identity and troubleshoot discrepancies in calculations. Document and communicate discrepancies to developers and follow through to resolution.
Manage client (internal and external) queries and client escalations.
User acceptance testing for new or enhanced product functionality. Execute test cases to confirm completion of technical, functional requirements for new fixed income products and system releases.
Liaise with counterparts/stakeholders within the wider team.
Identify data quality improvement projects and opportunities to enhance operational efficiency.




Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

3 years+ of business-related experience in the fixed income financial services industry.
Experience related to fixed income reference data management and UAT testing required.
Strong knowledge and understanding of a range of fixed income products, including bonds, money market products and interest rate derivatives.
Strong knowledge of fixed income trading and familiarity with terms and conditions of fixed income securities, including settlement protocols.
Strong investigating and problem-solving skills - acute attention to detail.
Demonstrates analytical thinking and sound judgement when making decisions.
Outstanding organizational skills, highly motivated and adaptable to a changing
business environment.
Must have exceptional time management skills.
Working knowledge of new bond issuance procedure desirable.
Working knowledge of corporate bonds and new bond issuance procedure desirable.
Bilingualism (French/English) is an asset.




Education

University degree in a related discipline.
Canadian Securities Course (CSC) certification is an asset.




Interested in being a part of CanDeal? We look forward to your application!

If you are interested in this opportunity please send your resume to: peopleandculture@candeal.com




Please inform us if you require any accommodations during the hiring process. Please note that only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Data Governance Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a Data Governance Analyst




The Data Governance Analyst is part of the Enterprise Data Governance Team and plays an essential role the advancement of our data strategy and maintenance of existing Data Governance Practices. This role provides the opportunity to balance enablement of our business with the governance of our data assets to ensure the trust and protection of the data in our care.

The successful candidate will join a skilled team of like-minded colleagues who are naturally curious, collaborative and strive to make sense of our data, protect it and work to enable the business to advance their data roadmaps.




What you will do

Support the development, maintenance, and enhancement our data governance policy, standards, processes, and practices.
Support the implementation and adoption of data governance across the enterprise
Work with technology and business users to ensure our data is understood and reflected in our Data Inventory to enable people to find what they need when they need it.
Support requirement definition and analysis as we build out our Connected Data Platform, connecting people to the data they need.
Identify opportunities to improve effectiveness of the data governance organization with focus on operational efficiency and collaboration
Provide front line support to our data community and translate complex topics into simple and effective statements that have impact
Support strategic decisions, issues, risks, and milestones related to data initiatives

What you will bring

7+ years of applied data governance experience
Strong organizational Skills
Expert in Microsoft products (PowerPoint and Excel)
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Agile, practical, customer service-oriented mindset (doesn‚Äôt over complicate processes)
Passionately curious and excited to learn new things
Ability to work in a fast paced highly focused team
Experience in financial services and insurance is an asset
Data certification in Data Management or Data Governance an asset (e.g. DGSP or CDMP)
Working knowledge of data governance and management technology an asset (e.g. Collibra, Microsoft Purview)

Role profile description: Using Microsoft Purview Data Catalog Portal, work with the team to create a POC that aligns to the metadata strategy and establishing the cataloging/business glossary, tagging, metadata, necessary to meet the standard by working with the business stakeholders.

‚Ä¢ Cataloging activities

‚Ä¢ Tagging

‚Ä¢ Metadata

‚Ä¢ Data Quality




If you are interested, please click apply with your updated CV.

Title: Data Governance Analyst
Description:
Data Governance Associate Familiarity with data management and governance tools (e.g., IBM Knowledge Catalog, Informatica, Collibra, Alation, Talend)

12+ Months Contract position

Location: Toronto (Hybrid)







What you‚Äôll do:

Reporting to the Data Enablement Manager, the Data Governance Analyst will serve as a liaison between data governance teams and data stewards across departments to ensure consistent application of data governance policies and practices.




Data Stewardship Liaison, Policy, and Compliance Support:

Act as a key Liaison and serve as a central point of contact for all governance-related communications.
Ensure that policies, initiatives, and best practices are clearly communicated to business units, and other stakeholders and provide input for the development and communication of guidelines to help Data Owners/Stewards effectively manage their domains in alignment with company-wide governance goals.
Support data stewards in creating and maintaining data dictionaries, glossaries, and metadata management in CTC‚Äôs Data Governance tools including our Enterprise Data Catalog (IBM IKC) and ensure data sources are cataloged and are well-maintained with clear definitions and standards in place.
Support the implementation and maintenance of data quality frameworks, ensuring data meets the required standards for completeness, accuracy, consistency, and timeliness and assist data stewards in managing and ensuring the accuracy, consistency, and security of data within their domains.
Develop and maintain documentation on data stewardship processes, governance standards, and policies and ensure roles and responsibilities are clearly defined, documented, and aligned with governance objectives.
Regularly update the Accountability Framework for Data to reflect organizational changes in management structure, business processes, or governance policies.
Collaborate with business units and IT teams to identify and assign Data Owners/Stewards for new assets, ensuring accountability across the lifecycle.
Assist with audits and reporting related to data governance and stewardship compliance.




Data Literacy and Training:

Support the develop and help to coordinate and deliver training programs to ensure employees understand the importance of governance and how to apply it in their day-to-day work.
Support the creation of training materials, user guides, and documentation to aid users in understanding governance tools, policies, and best practices.
Promote data literacy across the organization by providing resources that help employees understand data governance principles.




Communication

Support the ongoing maintenance of the Data Governance Website that serves as a central hub for all governance-related information.
Create and organize content including policies, procedures, templates, training materials, and FAQs.
Track usage of the portal to identify opportunities for improving user experience and content quality.
Develop strategies for communicating news, activities, tasks related to data & AI governance across the organization.
Produce newsletters or regular updates highlighting important governance activities and achievements.
Ensure timely dissemination of information regarding policy changes, upcoming training sessions, or critical updates through various communication channels (e.g., email bulletins, intranet posts).




What you bring:

5+ years of experience in data governance, data management, or related fields, with a focus on data quality, policy implementation, and compliance
Experience with data governance tools, metadata management systems, and data stewardship practices is a plus
2+ years of experience in a leadership role managing teams of data stewards or data governance professionals
Proven experience with data quality frameworks, data governance principles, and metadata management
Familiarity with data privacy laws (e.g., PIPEDA) and regulatory requirements
Familiarity with data management and governance tools (e.g., IBM Knowledge Catalog, Informatica, Collibra, Alation, Talend)
Experience with SQL and data modeling tools is a plus
Familiarity with cloud-based data platforms
Ability to develop and deliver training materials and workshops
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Communications, Information Systems, or Computer Science a related field, or equivalent work experience
Certifications in data governance (e.g., DAMA, CDMP) or related fields are a plus

Show more

  • Create and organize content including policies, procedures, templates, training materials, and FAQs.
  • Track usage of the portal to identify opportunities for improving user experience and content quality.
  • Develop strategies for communicating news, activities, tasks related to data & AI governance across the organization.
  • Produce newsletters or regular updates highlighting important governance activities and achievements.
  • Ensure timely dissemination of information regarding policy changes, upcoming training sessions, or critical updates through various communication channels (e.g., email bulletins, intranet posts).


What you bring:

  • 5+ years of experience in data governance, data management, or related fields, with a focus on data quality, policy implementation, and compliance
  • Experience with data governance tools, metadata management systems, and data stewardship practices is a plus
  • 2+ years of experience in a leadership role managing teams of data stewards or data governance professionals
  • Proven experience with data quality frameworks, data governance principles, and metadata management
  • Familiarity with data privacy laws (e.g., PIPEDA) and regulatory requirements
  • Familiarity with data management and governance tools (e.g., IBM Knowledge Catalog, Informatica, Collibra, Alation, Talend)
  • Experience with SQL and data modeling tools is a plus
  • Familiarity with cloud-based data platforms
  • Ability to develop and deliver training materials and workshops
  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Communications, Information Systems, or Computer Science a related field, or equivalent work experience
  • Certifications in data governance (e.g., DAMA, CDMP) or related fields are a plus

Title: Digital Analyst ‚Äì Adobe Analytics
Description:
About Act Digital



Act Digital is a multinational technology consulting firm specializing in digital transformation, IT, and cybersecurity. With over 6,000 professionals worldwide, we partner with leading organizations to deliver innovative, data-driven solutions that accelerate business performance. Our Canadian team, based in Montreal and Toronto, supports clients across banking, insurance, retail, and technology sectors, helping them leverage analytics and technology to make informed strategic decisions.





Job Description



Responsibilities



Build, maintain, and optimize Adobe Analytics dashboards for multiple business units and stakeholders.



Ensure data quality through continuous validation and monitoring of analytics implementations.



Investigate and resolve tracking anomalies, collaborating with technical teams to deliver fixes impacting reporting accuracy.



Provide tracking strategies and measurement plans to support analytics needs across Canadian and U.S. sites.



Manage Adobe Analytics user access and onboarding for internal teams.



Perform deep-dive analyses in clickstream and other datasets to uncover insights beyond standard reporting.



Deliver omnichannel insights by combining digital analytics with client/customer data sources.



Collaborate with marketing, retail, and business teams to align analytics deliverables with strategic goals.



Manage timelines and priorities to ensure on-time delivery of high-quality analytics solutions.





Qualifications



Required Skills & Qualifications



Minimum 2 years of experience in digital analytics, with strong expertise in Adobe Analytics.



Solid understanding of web analytics implementations, tracking strategy, and data validation.



Proficiency with data visualization tools such as Adobe Workspace, Tableau, Google Data Studio, and Pointillist.



Experience with clickstream analysis and omnichannel reporting.



Analytical mindset with the ability to turn complex datasets into actionable recommendations.



Bilingual proficiency (English required, French an asset).



Strong collaboration skills with cross-functional teams (marketing, data, and IT).



Project management skills with the ability to handle multiple priorities.



Google Analytics certification or equivalent is an asset.



Knowledge of Looker or similar BI tools is a plus.



Show more

Position Overview

Autodesk has invested in data-driven decision-making, optimizing our platform‚Äôs business, product, and cost. The next five years will transform how we work, with a surge in data volume and scaling of AI/ML to provide even greater value to our customers. We are looking for a Principal Data Analyst to join Autodesk‚Äôs Platform Strategy and Emerging Technologies organization on this transformative journey and to drive data-informed decision-making through advanced data analytics and insights.

You are passionate about delivering proactive insights and partnering with stakeholders to generate analysis that that influence product roadmap decisions. You will play a pivotal role in empowering product teams by surfacing valuable customer and product usage data and acting a thought partner, guiding them in turning insights into strategic actions. Your expertise in uncovering trends and translating large streams of data into clear, actionable insights will drive forward platform strategic initiatives and elevate decision-making across our organization. This role reports to the Sr. Manager, Data Analytics.

Preference for candidates to work hybrid/remote from Toronto or Montreal offices.

If you are excited about empowering teams and influencing the organization with insights that drive success, this is the role for you!

Responsibilities


Collaborate with product managers and cross-functional teams to identify, define, and address business problems and opportunities through data analysis. Use your analytical skills to derive actionable insights from large and complex datasets
Monitor and track key performance indicators (KPIs) and objectives and key results (OKRs) across platform initiatives, providing regular updates and insights to key stakeholders and ensuring visibility into data-driven insights that support organizational goals
Work closely with product, engineering, and business teams to understand their data needs, provide analytical support, and communicate findings in a clear and concise manner to technical and non-technical audiences
Create clear and impactful data visualizations using tools such as Power BI, Looker, or similar, to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders across the organization
Proactively mine for data drive insights to support PSET's platform initiatives, focusing on performance, user engagement, and overall business impact
Develop and implement advanced data models and statistical analyses to forecast trends, predict outcomes, and optimize decision-making processes across platform initiatives
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity by following best practices in data collection, cleaning, and analysis, allowing for high-quality insights. Identify and resolve data discrepancies as needed
Mentor and support junior analysts by providing technical guidance, sharing best practices, and fostering a culture of continuous learning within the team


Minimum Qualifications


8+ years of experience in large data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field, preferably within a technology or SaaS environment
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline
Strong skills in data querying and manipulation with SQL, and proficiency in programming languages like Python or R for data analysis and modeling. Experience with data warehouse ELT tools (Airflow, dbt, Snowflake)
Experience with data visualization tools such as Looker, Power BI, or similar, with the ability to create clear, engaging, and impactful dashboards. Familiarity with AWS, Azure or similar cloud platforms
Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities, with the capability to work independently on complex datasets and derive actionable insights
Knowledge of statistical techniques and modeling methodologies to drive in-depth data insights and support predictive analytics
Strong ability to communicate complex data insights and recommendations to technical and non-technical stakeholders in a clear and accessible manner
Effective team player with a strong ability to work across functions, engage with diverse stakeholders, and provide data-driven support for strategic initiatives.


Preferred Qualifications


Prior experience working in a SaaS company or a platform engineering organization is preferred
Familiarity with Autodesk‚Äôs product portfolio and its applications in various industries is an advantage
Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline

Title: Business Operations Analyst
Description:
Share

Share

Email

Tweet

Share

Blum Construction offers unparalleled stability in the construction industry. Founded in 1923, we have weathered tough economic storms for over a century and have emerged as a stronger organization with each challenge. With offices in Winston-Salem, Greensboro, Asheville, Charlotte, and Raleigh, we build structures that transform communities through our work in higher education, senior living, healthcare, non-profits and many other sectors.

We understand, very clearly, that it is our people who will enable us to be even stronger in our second century.

Position Summary

The Business Operations Analyst is a strategic partner in driving operational excellence at Blum Construction. This role is focused on helping the organization understand what operational data is needed, how to efficiently collect it, how to interpret it, and how to present it in a way that drives meaningful action. By working closely with individual departments, project teams, and regional leaders, the analyst helps translate complex data into clear insights that improve decision-making, streamline processes, and enhance overall performance. This is a high-visibility, high-growth opportunity for a curious, detail-oriented problem solver who is passionate about using data to make a real impact on the business.

Key Responsibilities


Collect, analyze, and interpret business operations data
Translate data into clear, compelling visualizations that support decision-making
Support the development of business operational dashboards and KPIs to provide real-time insights to corporate and regional leadership
Partner with various department leaders to identify and document process improvement opportunities and compliance.
Collaborate with all departments to align operational data with enterprise systems and reporting needs.
Assist with rollout and tracking of strategic business operational initiatives.
Create reporting templates, workflows, and tools that streamline decision-making across various departments. .
Communicate findings and recommendations in plain language to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Build repeatable processes and frameworks for ongoing data collection, review, and reporting.
Serve as a thought partner in helping the organization become more data-informed in its daily decisions and long-term strategy.
Support the EVP of Operations in preparing presentations, updates, and reports for internal and external stakeholders.


Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Construction Management, Engineering, Business Analytics, or related field.
2-5 years of experience in construction operations or similar field
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; ability to distill complex data into clear insights.
Proficient in Excel; experience with Power BI, Tableau, or similar visualization tools is a plus.
Familiarity with construction workflows, terminology, and systems
Strong interpersonal and communication skills; able to collaborate effectively across roles and levels.
Self-starter with a growth mindset and an interest in learning the business from the ground up.


Success in This Role Looks Like


Clear, timely data supporting field and leadership decision-making
Documented process improvements that reduce waste or increase efficiency
High engagement with field leaders to understand day-to-day operations
Proactive identification of performance trends and improvement opportunities
Demonstrated ownership of analytics and reporting tasks


Benefits


Medical Insurance
Dental Insurance
Vision Insurance
Life Insurance
Short Term Disability
401(K) matching
PTO
Gym Reimbursement
NOTE: Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions


Equal Opportunity Employer, including disabled and veterans.

Title: Special Agent
Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION
The position advertised has been exempted from the federal civilian hiring freeze.
As an FBI special agent, you'll directly impact national security. By harnessing your background to transition into federal law enforcement, you can help shape the Bureau‚Äôs approach to safeguarding our nation. At the FBI, you will have the opportunity to channel your expertise to protect our nation from cyberattacks, terrorism, fraud, and evolving threats. From conducting high-stakes investigations to leveraging your depth of knowledge in cybersecurity to uncover crucial information, your technical skills are essential to investigating crimes that threaten public safety. Your transition from a specialized career to a special agent role will be transformative, utilizing your expertise to tackle national security challenges in innovative ways. Every day brings new challenges that demand your adaptability and resilience, but you‚Äôre not alone in this journey. The Bureau matches your dedication with a commitment to professional growth, a supportive work environment, and a robust benefits package that prioritizes you. Set yourself apart. Apply today.

HOW TO APPLY

STEP 1: Click on the ‚ÄúApply‚Äù button to be directed to the FBIJobs Careers website.

STEP 2: Click the ‚ÄúStart‚Äù button to begin. You will be prompted to either sign in to continue or register with FBIJobs if you don‚Äôt already have an account.

STEP 3: Follow the step-by-step process to submit your interest. You will be guided through each step. You must complete all sections of the form AND ALL REQUIRED DOCUMENTS MUST BE ATTACHED to successfully submit your interest.


1. Your resume, specifically noting relevant work experience and associated start and end dates.
2. Other supporting documents:


College transcripts, if qualifying based on education or if there is a positive education requirement.


Veterans: DD 214; Disabled Veterans: DD 214, SF-15, and VA letter dated 1991 or later.


Please see instructions on the site for attaching documents.

SALARY LEVEL

Pay level for this position:


$99,461.00‚Äì$128,329.00


Salary is commensurate with base, locality, and availability pay.

DUTIES


Plan and conduct investigations of potential violations of federal laws, cybersecurity, and public safety
Exercise judgment, resourcefulness, and versatility in meeting investigative demands
Create and maintain effective liaison relationships with federal, state, local, tribal, territorial, and international law enforcement agencies.
Maintain a level of physical fitness to ensure the readiness required to perform law enforcement duties.


KEY REQUIREMENTS


Must be a U.S. citizen
Must be able to obtain a Top Secret Sensitive Compartmented Information (SCI) Clearance.
Must be willing to travel as required
Must meet the FBI‚Äôs Employment Eligibility requirements.
Must have a bachelor's degree or higher from a U.S.-accredited college or university


The FBI is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for this vacancy. Unless explicitly authorized by law, selection will be made without regard to, and there will be no discrimination because of, color, race, religion, national origin, marital status, parental status, physical or mental disability, genetic information, age (40 or over), sex (including pregnancy and related conditions, gender identity, and sexual orientation), or on the basis of personal favoritism, or any other non-merit factors

Title: Demand Planner I
Description:
Summary

Generate demand accurate baseline forecast for company accounts and Stock Keeping Units (SKU) for multiple brand lines within multiple channels. Examines inventory levels for product to ascertain company‚Äôs optimal financial performance and potential future sales. Analyzes and manipulates aggregated forecast, shipments data and time-series into comprehensive documents to be published with senior leadership and suppliers for planning purposes.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities


Generate demand accurate baseline forecast for company accounts and Stock Keeping Units (SKU) for multiple brand lines within multiple channels to reflect insightful analyses of seasonal patterns, POS trends, planned promotions and impact of competitive activity. Must maintain high level of accuracy and utilize advanced analytical & statistical skills.
Facilitated collaborative monthly forecast meetings with Sales, Marketing and Operations team to review the baseline demand plan along with market trends and program assumptions to drive to a consensus forecast.
Analyzes and manipulates aggregated forecast, shipments data and time-series into comprehensive documents to be published with senior leadership and suppliers for planning purposes.
Participates in yearly financial budgeting.
Define SKU level Safety stock through mathematical model to achieve in stock and inventory goals.
Communicate with brand managers to identify discrepancies with life cycle codes and correct them in Renfro‚Äôs in-house system & database.
Creates an interpretation of data through the use of tools, Mathematics, Statistics, industry experience and logic to frame situations and allow meaningful dialogue and decision making.
Analyzes data by comparing the planned output with actual output and correct imbalances.
Meaningfully interprets the data and present it through dynamic visualization.
Creates retail sales and shipment trend reporting for collaboration for maximize sales and supply chain efficiency.
Collaborates on day-to-day business requirements with sales, production planning and operations to achieve inventory turn goals and sales budget to anticipate unidentified factors affecting the supply chain through intimate knowledge of product development initiatives
Creates reports, data bases and participates in line planning, merchandising, and post-seasonal reviews by providing product performance and customer behavior analysis.
Create mathematic and statistic models that best fit each category/brand and test created models to ensure high accuracy.
Provides ad hoc business analyses as needed.
Creates effective channels of communication with external and internal account contacts. Consults with these contacts as needed to verify accuracy of data, future strategies and current state.
Conducts store visits to better understand competitive products, pricing and changes.
Utilizes problem solving methods to accurately define problems, generates alternatives and implements counter measures that permanently resolve planning problems by addressing their root cause.
Conform with and abide by all regulations, policies, work procedures and instructions including but not limited to confidentiality requirements.


Professional Qualifications


Excellent attention to detail, time management skills and meeting deadlines
Positive attitude and ability to handle highly confidential information
Ability to reflect positive attitude and disciplined work ethic
Ability to work in a team
Ability to work independently
High energy level
Strong interpersonal skills
Demonstrated experience in being a self-starter
Ability to deal with internal/external customers with enthusiasm and professionalism
Strong verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills are essential
Must possess confidence, good judgment, energy and the right personality to work in a challenging environment


EDUCATION And/or EXPERIENCE


High School education and degree, either Associates or Bachelor‚Äôs, in economics, mathematics, finance, statistics, engineering, supply chain, analytics or related field, or equivalent work experience.
Prefer at least three years of relevant and related work experience, such as in retail, wholesale sales, buying, planning or supply chain.
Computer skills: SQL, Access, Microsoft Office products, with expert level with Excel.
Desired experience working with web-based portals, business intelligence tools such as Qlik, Tableau, and Microsoft Dynamics.
Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, etc.) to manipulate and analyze data a plus.


KNOWLEDGE, SKILL AND ABILITY


Must be a team builder and ability to navigate and work effectively in a large corporate matrixed organization. Ability to collaborate with a team and act in an objective manner to solve problems. Self-starter with proven experience in delivering results to an organization.
Demonstrated excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Position requires interaction with senior level management, executives and customers.
Must be able to work unsupervised and thrive in a stressful environment; ability to work effectively under tight deadlines and in high-pressure situations.
Strong understanding of merchandise planning, allocation strategies, inventory management and operational accuracy.
Must have exceptional attention to detail with proven analytical and critical thinking skills.
Strong organizational skills with a proven ability to move multiple projects forward in a constructive and positive manner.
Familiarity with standard forecasting concepts, practices and procedures.
Self-starter with proven experience in delivering results to an organization.


Physical Demands/Work Environment

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Minimal physical demands, such as occasional bending, stooping and walking. Requires frequent computer work. Consistent daily attendance required; occasional off-shift support required. Occasionally required to travel domestically to other office locations.

WORK ENVIRONMENT

The work environmental characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Generally, will work in conditioned office environment.

Occasional: activity exists less than 1/3 of the time.

Frequent: activity exists 1/3 and 2/3 of the time.


The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by associates and are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties, and skills required. Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of the employer at any time with or without notice.


AA/EOE/Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disabled. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without race, color, gender (including pregnancy), gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, religion, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information or other protected characteristics.*

Title: Vice President, Analytics & Process
Description:
Description

About Allegacy Federal Credit Union

For 58 years, Allegacy Federal Credit Union has been committed to accelerating the success of our members through superior value and inspiring service. Headquartered in Winston-Salem, Allegacy has grown into one of North Carolina‚Äôs largest credit unions‚Äî serving more than 179,000 members with $2.4 billion in assets and over $1.7 billion in assets under management through Allegacy Investment Group.

With 19 locations across the Triad and Charlotte regions, Allegacy offers a full suite of personal and business financial services to members, including the employees, retirees, and families of more than 5,000 companies across the state of North Carolina. Every interaction is an opportunity to deliver superior value and inspiring service - bringing our common purpose to life and helping our members, employees, and communities thrive!

The Opportunity

We‚Äôre seeking a strategic, data-savvy leader for our VP of Analytics & Process. This role will define, build, and oversee our enterprise-wide data management and analytics strategy, delivering transformational impact through advanced data science, actionable business intelligence, and intelligent automation.

Reporting directly to the CIO, you‚Äôll lead efforts around data integrity, quality, and governance ‚Äì while fostering operational excellence and process improvement through data-driven methodologies. You‚Äôll empower teams across the organization by embedding insights directly into the workflows that drive member success.

Primary Responsibilities

Strategic Analytics & Data Science Leadership


Establish and lead Allegacy‚Äôs strategic analytics vision, aligning data science and advanced analytics initiatives with key business objectives.
Drive analytics maturity across predictive modeling, AI/ML, segmentation, behavioral analysis, and prescriptive insights.
Foster an insights-driven culture, translating complex data into clear, actionable strategies that drive growth and efficiency.


Enterprise Business Intelligence & Data Management


Lead the strategy and execution of the enterprise business intelligence roadmap, ensuring availability, accuracy, consistency, and scalability of data assets.
Oversee data governance, data quality standards, data lineage, metadata management, and compliance with regulatory frameworks.
Champion best-in-class BI tools and cloud data solutions (Power BI, Snowflake, Azure/AWS ecosystems, etc.) to provide real-time insights and decision support across teams.


Process Excellence & Intelligent Automation


Spearhead data-driven process improvement initiatives, using analytics and automation to identify inefficiencies and accelerate performance.
Lead automation strategies, deploying Robotic Process Automation (RPA), workflow automation, and low-code solutions that streamline operations and improve member experiences.
Embed continuous improvement methodologies (e.g., Lean Six Sigma) across functions, fostering a culture of data-informed operational excellence.


Cross-Functional Alignment & Collaboration


Partner closely with executive stakeholders, including Digital Channels, Finance, Operations, Marketing, Risk, and Information Security, ensuring data strategies align with broader organizational goals.
Support and Influence enterprise-wide strategic planning with insights, predictive modeling, and data-driven recommendations.
Lead, mentor, recognize and develop a high-performing, collaborative team of data analysts, data scientists, BI professionals, and process improvement experts.


Knowledge, Skills And Abilities


Proven expertise with advanced analytics, statistical modeling, predictive analytics, and machine learning frameworks (e.g., Python, R, TensorFlow, Azure ML, etc.).
Strong background in enterprise data management, data quality practices, metadata management, and data governance within regulated environments.
Demonstrated success implementing and scaling BI platforms, data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau), and cloud data warehousing solutions (e.g., Snowflake, Azure, AWS).
Experience deploying intelligent automation solutions, such as RPA, intelligent workflows, or process automation platforms (e.g., UiPath, Power Automate, ServiceNow).
A record of driving measurable improvements in process efficiency, member/customer satisfaction, and organizational performance through data-driven methodologies.
Exceptional executive communication skills with the ability to clearly translate data complexity into strategic insights at board and leadership levels.


Requirements


Education Required: Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent experience
Preferred Education: Master‚Äôs Degree
Experience Required: 10+ years of progressive leadership in analytics, data science, business intelligence, or related fields, including experience managing large, cross-functional teams. 7+ years of Management Experience with demonstrated strategic leadership.
Certifications or deep experience in data management methodologies or operational excellence frameworks preferred
Hands-on experience with deploying AI-powered decision engines or integrating predictive analytics into real-time business processes preferred.
Familiarity with financial industry data ecosystems and regulatory compliance frameworks preferred.
Experience in at least one of the following: leading analytics modernization, digital transformation, or enterprise-wide data strategy programs.

HTML:
Description

About Allegacy Federal Credit Union

For 58 years, Allegacy Federal Credit Union has been committed to accelerating the success of our members through superior value and inspiring service. Headquartered in Winston-Salem, Allegacy has grown into one of North Carolina‚Äôs largest credit unions‚Äî serving more than 179,000 members with $2.4 billion in assets and over $1.7 billion in assets under management through Allegacy Investment Group.

With 19 locations across the Triad and Charlotte regions, Allegacy offers a full suite of personal and business financial services to members, including the employees, retirees, and families of more than 5,000 companies across the state of North Carolina. Every interaction is an opportunity to deliver superior value and inspiring service - bringing our common purpose to life and helping our members, employees, and communities thrive!

The Opportunity

We‚Äôre seeking a strategic, data-savvy leader for our VP of Analytics & Process. This role will define, build, and oversee our enterprise-wide data management and analytics strategy, delivering transformational impact through advanced data science, actionable business intelligence, and intelligent automation.

Reporting directly to the CIO, you‚Äôll lead efforts around data integrity, quality, and governance ‚Äì while fostering operational excellence and process improvement through data-driven methodologies. You‚Äôll empower teams across the organization by embedding insights directly into the workflows that drive member success.

Primary Responsibilities

Strategic Analytics & Data Science Leadership

  • Establish and lead Allegacy‚Äôs strategic analytics vision, aligning data science and advanced analytics initiatives with key business objectives.
  • Drive analytics maturity across predictive modeling, AI/ML, segmentation, behavioral analysis, and prescriptive insights.
  • Foster an insights-driven culture, translating complex data into clear, actionable strategies that drive growth and efficiency.

Enterprise Business Intelligence & Data Management

  • Lead the strategy and execution of the enterprise business intelligence roadmap, ensuring availability, accuracy, consistency, and scalability of data assets.
  • Oversee data governance, data quality standards, data lineage, metadata management, and compliance with regulatory frameworks.
  • Champion best-in-class BI tools and cloud data solutions (Power BI, Snowflake, Azure/AWS ecosystems, etc.) to provide real-time insights and decision support across teams.

Process Excellence & Intelligent Automation

  • Spearhead data-driven process improvement initiatives, using analytics and automation to identify inefficiencies and accelerate performance.
  • Lead automation strategies, deploying Robotic Process Automation (RPA), workflow automation, and low-code solutions that streamline operations and improve member experiences.
  • Embed continuous improvement methodologies (e.g., Lean Six Sigma) across functions, fostering a culture of data-informed operational excellence.

Cross-Functional Alignment & Collaboration

  • Partner closely with executive stakeholders, including Digital Channels, Finance, Operations, Marketing, Risk, and Information Security, ensuring data strategies align with broader organizational goals.
  • Support and Influence enterprise-wide strategic planning with insights, predictive modeling, and data-driven recommendations.
  • Lead, mentor, recognize and develop a high-performing, collaborative team of data analysts, data scientists, BI professionals, and process improvement experts.

Knowledge, Skills And Abilities

  • Proven expertise with advanced analytics, statistical modeling, predictive analytics, and machine learning frameworks (e.g., Python, R, TensorFlow, Azure ML, etc.).
  • Strong background in enterprise data management, data quality practices, metadata management, and data governance within regulated environments.
  • Demonstrated success implementing and scaling BI platforms, data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau), and cloud data warehousing solutions (e.g., Snowflake, Azure, AWS).
  • Experience deploying intelligent automation solutions, such as RPA, intelligent workflows, or process automation platforms (e.g., UiPath, Power Automate, ServiceNow).
  • A record of driving measurable improvements in process efficiency, member/customer satisfaction, and organizational performance through data-driven methodologies.
  • Exceptional executive communication skills with the ability to clearly translate data complexity into strategic insights at board and leadership levels.

Requirements

  • Education Required: Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent experience
  • Preferred Education: Master‚Äôs Degree
  • Experience Required: 10+ years of progressive leadership in analytics, data science, business intelligence, or related fields, including experience managing large, cross-functional teams. 7+ years of Management Experience with demonstrated strategic leadership.
  • Certifications or deep experience in data management methodologies or operational excellence frameworks preferred
  • Hands-on experience with deploying AI-powered decision engines or integrating predictive analytics into real-time business processes preferred.
  • Familiarity with financial industry data ecosystems and regulatory compliance frameworks preferred.
  • Experience in at least one of the following: leading analytics modernization, digital transformation, or enterprise-wide data strategy programs.

Title: Customer Service Clerk
Description:
Description

Under immediate supervision, uses established procedures to assist customers with cemetery-related matters regarding City-owned cemeteries.

Examples of Duties

This position is the primary contact with customers arranging for a burial in a city-owned cemetery or requesting cemetery-related services, such as the purchase of an appropriate memorial to mark a grave or seeking historical data for genealogical research. This position is responsible for advising customers, as per City Code, on cemetery-related matters, completing purchase agreements, collecting funds, preparing and reconciling daily cash collection reports and bank deposits, providing support for various accounts receivable and accounts payable functions and other related work as required. This position is responsible for the accurate recordation of related transactions and working with various vendors and local service providers to assure customer satisfaction.

Typical Qualifications

Education and Experience

Any combination of education and experience equivalent to a high school diploma and considerable experience in direct customer contact, general clerical work and the application of general accounting principles on a daily basis.

Knowledge, Skills And Abilities

Thorough knowledge of standard office methods and procedures, including a working knowledge of both Microsoft Word and Excel, demonstrated professional written and oral communication skills, ability to read, interpret and appropriately apply established procedures and City Code.

Physical Requirements

This work is sedentary and requires little to no exertion of force; work regularly requires sitting, speaking or hearing and using hands to finger, handle or feel, frequently requires walking and occasionally requires standing; work has standard vision requirements; vocal communication is required for expressing or exchanging ideas by means of the spoken word and conveying detailed or important instructions to others accurately, loudly or quickly; hearing is required to perceive information at normal spoken word levels and to receive detailed information through oral communications and/or to make fine distinctions in sound; work requires preparing and analyzing written or computer data and observing general surroundings and activities; work is generally in a moderately noisy location (e.g. business office, light traffic).

Title: Real Estate Agent
Description:
Job Description

Are you a driven, customer-focused individual looking to build a successful career in real estate? Our local Weichert¬Æ franchised company is seeking enthusiastic Real Estate Agents to join our dynamic team. Whether you're just starting or have years of experience, we provide the training, tools, and support to help you thrive in this exciting industry.

Responsibilities


Assist clients in buying, selling, and renting properties
Conduct property showings, open houses, and market analysis
Build and maintain a robust client base through networking and lead generation
Guide clients through the entire real estate process, from initial consultation to closing
Utilize Weichert‚Äôsstate-of-the-art myWeichert CRM and marketing tools to manage leads and market properties effectively
Stay up to date with local market trends, regulations, and best practices


Qualifications


High school diploma or GED
Valid real estate license (or willingness to obtain one)
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Strong negotiation skills and the ability to close deals effectively
Self-motivated, ambitious, and driven to succeed
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Willingness to attend ongoing training and professional development sessions


What We Offer


Comprehensive Training: Access to Weichert University, onboarding and coaching programs, and regular training sessions to ensure your success
Cutting-Edge Technology: Use of our myWeichert CRM, automated marketing tools, and lead generation systems
Competitive Compensation: Attractive commission structures with performance-based incentives
Supportive Team Environment: Join a collaborative team that fosters growth and success, with administrative support to help manage your workload
Financial Growth Opportunities: A clear path to advance your business


How To Apply

If you‚Äôre ready to take your real estate career to the next level, we want to hear from you! Please click the ‚Äúapply now‚Äù button to submit your complete contact information to being the application process.

About Us

At our local Weichert¬Æ franchised office, we are committed to helping our agents succeed. As part of the Weichert¬Æ family, we offer the perfect blend of local expertise and national resources, ensuring our agents have everything they need to excel. Join us and be part of a winning team dedicated to delivering exceptional service and achieving outstanding results.

This position is a 1099 commission-based opportunity to propel your sales career to the next level.

Weichert¬Æ is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis, such as disability and veteran status, or any other basis covered under applicable law.

Each Weichert ¬Æ Franchised Office is Independently Owned and Operated.

By submitting this application, you consent to receive communication from Weichert ¬Æ or affiliated Weichert ¬Æ companies via text message, phone call, and email.

Title: Assistant Strategist - Fresh Graduates
Description:
Job Summary:

The Assistant Strategist, Business Solutions is responsible for supporting the team in the development of media plans, results analysis, and data management. This position requires an individual to strategically think and problem solve while paying meticulous attention to detail. The Assistant Strategist is expected to show integrity, a thirst for learning, drive and initiative, along with overall communication and organization skills to succeed in a fast-paced work environment.




Responsibilities:

Account Management

Assist with day-to-day account maintenance tasks inclusive of flowchart upkeep and creative material distribution.
Schedule, attend, and participate in client/internal meetings; capture and distribute meeting recap notes to clients and internal team members, summarizing all deliverables and next steps.
Keep the team updated on the status and timing of deliverables.
Collaborate with the team to identify data and billing discrepancies and recommend creative solutions.

Strategic Planning

Support team members with overall media plan development, budget tracking, implementation, and maintenance.
Analyze competitive and target research to inform media strategy

Internal Relationship Management

Engage and effectively interact with the direct team as well as other departments internally.

Training & Development

Advance knowledge and learn about the media industry and our clients.
Participate in training program, as well as other syndicated and proprietary training sessions (i.e. Excel Basics, Business Writing, Presentation Skills, and more).

Ôªø

Requirement:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Accounting, Finance, Financial, Marketing, Economics, Advertising, Communication, Management Information Systems, Supply Chain, Human Resources, Accountancy, Industrial Engineering.
Proficiency working within Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint.
Hungry to advance your knowledge of advertising, marketing, and media principles.
Willing to take initiative, be an active participant in team discussions.
An effective communicator who thinks strategically.
A problem solver with the ability to develop creative solutions.
Detail oriented with strong organizational skills.
Comfortable working with multiple timelines and deliverables; able to effectively manage your time.
Someone who thrives working both independently and within a team.
Comfortable working within large sets of data and numbers.
Successful in an agile, fast paced environment.
Results and solutions oriented; consistently motivated, proactive, and resourceful.
An advocate for and supporter of diversity, equity and inclusion.




Procedure: We are an HR consultancy firm, and we help candidates match with the potential roles by using an Artificial Intelligence System which is free of cost. If you meet the eligibility criteria, please apply and our recruitment team will help you understand your strengths and strategize your career ahead. We can let you know better once you submit your resume.

Title: Data Modeler
Description:
Job Description




Job Responsibilities
Design and develop conceptual, logical, and physical data models to support business needs.
Apply dimensional modeling techniques (e.g., star schema) for data warehouse solutions.
Ensure proper data normalization and consistency across systems.
Write and optimize SQL queries for data validation and analysis.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into data models.
Implement data governance practices within BigQuery datasets and tables.
Work with data catalog tools to ensure proper data documentation and discoverability.
¬†Job Requirements
Strong knowledge of data modeling concepts and design patterns.
Experience with data warehouse architecture and dimensional modeling.
Proficiency in SQL and understanding of relational database structures.
Familiarity with BigQuery, data governance frameworks, and data cataloging tools.
Ability to work independently with minimal guidance.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field, or equivalent experience.




Show more
HTML:
Job Description


Job Responsibilities
  • Design and develop conceptual, logical, and physical data models to support business needs.
  • Apply dimensional modeling techniques (e.g., star schema) for data warehouse solutions.
  • Ensure proper data normalization and consistency across systems.
  • Write and optimize SQL queries for data validation and analysis.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into data models.
  • Implement data governance practices within BigQuery datasets and tables.
  • Work with data catalog tools to ensure proper data documentation and discoverability.
 Job Requirements
  • Strong knowledge of data modeling concepts and design patterns.
  • Experience with data warehouse architecture and dimensional modeling.
  • Proficiency in SQL and understanding of relational database structures.
  • Familiarity with BigQuery, data governance frameworks, and data cataloging tools.
  • Ability to work independently with minimal guidance.
  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field, or equivalent experience.

Title: Fall 2025 Associate, Analytics
Description:
Our Associate program is a paid opportunity that allows participants to contribute to the organization‚Äôs success while at the same time applying learnings from the classroom. This semester we will continue with a hybrid program and will offer each participant the opportunity to gain in-office experience for approximately 3-days a week. Associates are responsible for their individual transportation and housing needs.

Associate Expectations

All Associates are expected to work 24 -29.9 hours a week during the session. While each Associate will be working with a specific division, they will have the opportunity to learn about other areas within Excel, through lunch and learns held throughout the semester

Important Dates

Our Fall Program runs from Monday, September 22nd, 2025 through Friday, December 12th, 2025

Office Hours


9:00 am‚Äê6:00 PM CT, Monday-Friday OR as agreed upon with advisor. Days in office must be coordinated with Advisor‚Äôs schedules.


Our Associates Must


Be available to work under 30 hours per week.
Be available to report to the Chicago office approximately 3-days a week.
Have a senior standing in college (must have completed your junior year of undergrad)


OR


Be enrolled in a graduate school


OR


Have a bachelor‚Äôs or postgraduate degree.


Interview Process


Applications will close on August 22nd, 2025
If selected, the expectation is that offers will be extended early September.
The program will begin on September 22nd, 2025.


Divisions Role Objectives And Expectations

As an Excel Analytics associate, you will contribute to the evaluation and analysis of sports sponsorship opportunities and assist in determining the value and impact of sponsorships within the sports industry. This internship provides a unique opportunity to gain practical experience in sports analytics, specifically focusing on the valuation of sponsorships and partnerships. You will work closely with a team of professionals passionate about optimizing sponsorship strategies and maximizing return on investment for organizations and its partners.

Some Responsibilities Include


Database Creation and Management
Data Collection and Analysis
Market Research
Partnership Support and Evaluation
Cross-Functional Collaboration


Qualifications


Currently pursuing a bachelor's or master's degree in business, finance, economics, sports management, or a related field. Recent graduates may also be considered.
Strong analytical skills with a passion for utilizing data to drive business decisions and financial evaluations.
Proficiency with Excel
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex information in a clear and concise manner.
Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.
Experience or interest in database management and data organization.
Passion for sports and a basic understanding of the sports industry and sponsorship landscape is preferred.
Prior experience or coursework in sports analytics, sponsorship valuation, or related fields is a plus.


The pay for this position is: $16.20 per hour. Please note that the foregoing compensation information is a good-faith assessment associated with this position only and is provided pursuant to the California and New York City Salary Transparency Law.

Title: Research Intern - Microsoft Research AI Frontiers
Description:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for Microsoft Corporation. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

Microsoft Research (MSR) AI Frontiers lab is seeking applications for the position of Research Intern to join their team in Redmond, WA or New York City, NY.

The mission of the AI Frontiers (https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/research/lab/ai-frontiers/overview/) Lab is to expand the pareto frontier of Artificial Intelligence (AI) capabilities, efficiency, and safety through innovations in foundation models and learning agent platforms. Some of our projects include work on Small Language Models (e.g. Phi, Orca), agentic AI systems (e.g. AutoGen, MagenticOne, OmniParser), new transformer architectures (e.g. Belief State Transformers) and optimizers for scalable LLM Training (e.g. Dion).

We are seeking a Research Intern to join our team and contribute to efforts on the advancement of Generative AI and Large Language Model (LLM) Technologies. As a Research Intern, you will play a crucial role in developing, improving, and exploring the capabilities of LLMs and Multimodal AI models. Your work will have a significant impact on the development of cutting-edge technologies, advancing state-of-the-art and providing practical solutions to real-world problems.

Our ongoing research areas encompass but are not limited to:


Reasoning method for LLMs and multimodal models
New model architectures and training methods
Action models for automating web and computer tasks
Orchestration and multi-agent systems: automated orchestration between multiple agents incorporating human feedback and oversight
Evaluation and Understanding of model and agent capabilities


MSR offers a vibrant environment for‚ÄØcutting-edge, multidisciplinary, research, including access to diverse, real-world problems and data, opportunities for experimentation and real-world impact, an open publication policy, and close links to top academic institutions around the world.

Microsoft‚Äôs mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

In alignment with our Microsoft values, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day.

Responsibilities

Research Interns put inquiry and theory into practice. Alongside fellow doctoral candidates and some of the world‚Äôs best researchers, Research Interns learn, collaborate, and network for life. Research Interns not only advance their own careers, but they also contribute to exciting research and development strides. During the 12-week internship, Research Interns are paired with mentors and expected to collaborate with other Research Interns and researchers, present findings, and contribute to the vibrant life of the community. Research internships are available in all areas of research, and are offered year-round, though they typically begin in the summer.

Additional Responsibilities


As a Research Intern in MSR AI Frontiers Lab, you will perform cutting-edge research in collaboration with other researchers, engineers, and product groups.
As a member of a world-class research organization, you will be a part of research breakthroughs in the field and will be given an opportunity to realize your ideas in products and services used worldwide.
Embody our culture (https://careers.microsoft.com/v2/global/en/culture) and values (https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/about/corporate-values) .


Qualifications

Required Qualifications


Currently enrolled in a PhD program in Computer Science or a related STEM field.
Accepted or currently enrolled in a PhD program in Computer Science or related STEM field.


Other Requirements

Research Interns are expected to be physically located in their manager‚Äôs Microsoft worksite location for the duration of their internship.In addition to the qualifications above, you‚Äôll need to submit a minimum of two reference letters for this position. After you submit your application, a request for letters may be sent to your list of references on your behalf. Note that reference letters cannot be requested until after you have submitted your application, and furthermore, that they might not be automatically requested for all candidates. You may wish to alert your letter writers in advance, so they will be ready to submit your letter.

Preferred Qualifications


Experience publishing academic papers as a lead author or essential contributor in the field of Artificial Intelligence.
Experience participating in a top conference in relevant research domain.
Demonstrable ability to define an ambitious, original research agenda.
Ability to collaborate, communicate effectively, and work as part of a multi-disciplinary team.
Keen interest in real-world applications and impact.
Experience in Machine Learning, Computer Vision and related fields.
Research demonstrated by publications at the following conferences: NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, ACL, NAACL, CVPR, COLT, ECCV, ICCV, EMNLP.


The base pay range for this internship is USD $6,710 - $13,270 per month. There is a different range applicable to specific work

locations, within the San Francisco Bay area and New York City metropolitan area, and the base pay range for this role in those

locations is USD $8,760 - $14,360 per month.

Certain roles may be eligible for benefits and other compensation. Find additional benefits and pay information here: https://careers.microsoft.com/us/en/us-intern-pay

Microsoft accepts applications and processes offers for these roles on an ongoing basis.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations (https://careers.microsoft.com/v2/global/en/accessibility.html) .

If you have questions about this posting, please contact support@lensa.com

Title: Specialist, GIS
Description:
Our purpose is sustaining energy and water for life, and it is demonstrated in everything we do as a business, and as an employee team.

At Liberty, we hire passionate people who care about doing the right thing for our customers. We are entrepreneurial, creative, and outcome-focused. Here, your natural talent and achievements will flourish in an inclusive environment of teamwork, trust and continuous learning. We are always pursuing excellence to exceed our ambitions goals, rewarding both the goal outcome and how we achieve it.

Purpose

We‚Äôre looking for a detail-driven and collaborative GIS Specialist to maintain the accuracy and reliability of our electric network model. This role plays a critical part in ensuring regulatory compliance through meticulous data management and delivering spatial insights that empower teams across the organization. By building and maintaining intuitive GIS tools and applications, you‚Äôll help drive data-informed decisions and enhance the accessibility of geospatial information.

Accountabilities


Maintain and update the electric network model in the GIS system, ensuring data accuracy and completeness.
Generate and deliver customized data extracts and spatial analyses to support engineering, planning, and regulatory teams.
Ensure data and reporting meet regulatory compliance requirements through robust documentation and validation processes.
Develop, publish, and manage user-focused web maps and applications using ArcGIS Online and related technologies.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders to streamline workflows and promote GIS best practices across departments.
Document GIS processes, metadata standards, and system updates to support transparency and continuity.
Contribute to the ongoing improvement of GIS tools, geospatial strategy, and data quality initiatives.



Education and Experience


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Geography, GIS, Environmental Science, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
Proficiency with Esri ArcGIS software suite, including ArcGIS Pro and ArcGIS Online.
Experience with spatial analysis, cartography, and data visualization techniques.
Familiarity with regulatory reporting frameworks and utility network modeling is preferred.
Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset.



Preferred Skills:


Understanding of Python scripting, ModelBuilder, or SQL for GIS automation and data analysis.
Ability to manage multiple projects in a dynamic, cross-functional environment.
Demonstrated passion for continuous learning and process improvement.



Compensation Data

$53,622 - $129,648 per year


Liberty considers several factors when extending an offer, including but not limited to, the role and responsibilities, a candidate's work experience, education, training and skills, and geographic location. Base pay for this role is expected to fall within the mid to mid-point.



Algonquin Power & Utilities Corp. is a growing renewable energy and utility company with over $15 billion of assets across North America and internationally.

For more than 30 years, Algonquin has demonstrated an unwavering commitment to delivering clean energy and water solutions. Our rapid growth has led both our regulated utility services and renewable energy business groups into different geographies and commodities, but our purpose remains unchanged ‚Äì Sustaining Energy and Water for Life.

Through our operating business (Liberty), we provide regulated electricity, water, and natural gas utility services to over 1 million customer connections, primarily in North America. And, our growing portfolio of clean, renewable wind, solar, hydro and thermal power generation facilities represent over 3 GW of renewable generation capacity in operation and under construction.

With our robust, diversified, and growing presence in communities across North America and internationally, we are continually demonstrating our ‚ÄúThink Global, Act Local‚Äù business model.

What We Offer


Company funded Pension program
401k with Company match
Full insurance benefits (health/dental/vision/life)
Collaborative environment with a genuine flexible working policy
Share purchase/match plan
Defined Contribution savings plan
Top Talent Program
Volunteer paid days off
Employee Assistance Program
Achievement fund



We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you are excited about this role and are not certain you meet the all the qualification requirements, we encourage you to apply to further investigate the opportunity.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value each person‚Äôs unique background, diversity, experiences, perspectives and talents. Full participation of all employees in a safe, healthy and respectful environment is key to individual and company success. We are committed to fully utilizing the abilities of all of our employees and expect each of our employees to honor this commitment in their daily responsibilities.
Show more

  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Achievement fund

Title: Payroll Specialist
Description:
Description

Every day, Heartland, a Global Payments Company, makes it possible for millions of people to move money between buyers and sellers using our products and unmatched services. Simply, we create meaningful technology centered experiences that enable our customers to prosper. If you want to work like an entrepreneur, support and serve entrepreneurs and bring your expertise to a dynamic team, then Heartland is for you. If it's in your nature to work with a passion to provide tangible solutions for everyone you interact with, then join us and let's see what we can do together.

Job SummaryWe are looking for payroll support professionals who are excited to provide our clients with financial technology software and solutions that help businesses grow ‚Äì all with a superior customer service experience.

In this role, you‚Äôll introduce clients to new payroll products and services and help them learn how to customize and maximize them to meet their business needs. You‚Äôll help guide them through problems and serve as a liaison between users and product developers.

Heartland is dedicated to personal and professional development and helping our team members learn new skills and grow with the company. We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages, along with incentives and a culture of inclusion and camaraderie.

Duties


Maintain base of payroll clients and provide exceptional customer service to them via phone and email
Interact with clients to obtain payroll data and accurately enter data for processing
Meet deadlines and respond quickly to inquiries, even during times of high volume
Learn and maintain a working knowledge of Heartland Payroll Software and other products.
Assist clients with reports, problems, or other issues
Reach out to clients regarding new products and services
Develop relationships with other departments to ensure a positive customer experience


Job Requirements


High school diploma or equivalent
At least 1 year of work experience, preferably in customer-facing role
Reliable, responsible, detail-oriented, and professional
Excellent communication skills, especially via email and phone
Team-oriented, adaptable, flexible, collaborative, able to resolve conflicts
Proactive problem solver and critical thinker
Proficient in Google Suite
Accurate and fast data entry and typing skills
Ability to multitask
